subdued ouercame germains hee went afterwards also britannie force subdued roman empire iulia afterwards dying marcus crassus slain parthian mortall discord grew caesar pompey occasion whereof second fiue yeers caesar gouernment france beeing expired propounded pompeyes faction successor sent caesar desired command french war might prolonged absence might demand consulship beeing denied hee made another proposition would giue ouer army france vpon condition pompey like spain also denied enioyned leaue army passed riuer rubicon limit assigned passe taking city ariminum went fury directly rome pompey abandoned italie following end ouerthrew pharsalia whereupon pompey refuge repairing ptolomey king egypt small bark king direction slain hand septimius achila whose head ptolomys command presented caesar wept afterwards bending force ptolomy ouercoming passed egypt tamed pride egyptian thence went africa pursuing remainder pompeyes faction ouercame cato utica vnwilling fall caesar hand slue caesar returning rome triumphed afterwards going spain cruell battell wherein danger haue lost hee ouerthrew sextus pompeius eldest son great pompey returning rome hee took vpon dictatorship finally decius marcus brutus gaius cassius gaius casca attilius cimber quintus ligarius marcus spurius cornelius cinna many principall roman conspiring slain senat age yeers vpon fifteenth day march tribune formerly granted pompey good liking pompey would yeeld vnto lawes allow man demand consulship present forgetting made consul came lawfull age attained dignity contrary ordinarie course law common condition men blame another allow themselues denied caesar made another proposition hee would leaue army come rome priuate man pompey would giueouer held spain put question cause great distraction senate cicero cicero seek reconcile caesar pompey interposed labouring reconcile conclude jar peace pompey would haue tractable faction prime men rome stood proudly vpon tearms notwithstanding reasonable condition propounded caesar inflexible therefore decreed senate caesar decree senat caesar certain time prefixed leaue army hee passe ouer riuer rubicon boundin prouince declaring enemy roman state otherwise lvcivs antonivs qvintvs cvrio tribune people fauouring caesar opposed themselues decree disgraced illintreated thrust senate whereupon fled rome went caesar great help win heart souldiers office tribune held sacred inuiolable caesar hearing matter past seeing depriued future hope peace marcht speedily rauenna onely foot horse commanding legion follow presently joyn comming afterwards rubicon passe would hope peace remaining say staid good space considering importance passage misery would ensue plvtarch writes discoursed thereof asinivs pollio friend accompany appianvs alexandrinvs report hee vsed word doubtlesse forbear passe riuer beginning ruine caesar word past rubicon passe ruine generall svetonivs writes turning towards riuer said yet power turn back passing riuer wee must make way weapon writes moreouer caesar standing thus doubtfull irresolute animated apparition man extraordinary stature shape sitting neer vnto army piping vpon reed besides shepheards heardsmen many souldiers left guard went hear trumpetters hee caught hould one trumpet leapt forth riuer beginning mighty blast sound battell went pase bank side furious resolution army together svetonivs writes tribune common came vnto base dishonourable garment fledde rome hee made excellent oration fouldiers shedding tear tearing garment brest laying equity cause crauing help assistance hauing generall applause consent made answer ready obey parted presently next day came ariminum whereon seized like hee town castle beginning ciuill war past domitivs factious tumult nominated successour gaul held corfinium garrison cohort taken pardoned souldiers inhabitant intreated domitivs kindly giuing leaue depart went presently pompey act noble generous minde caesar obserued victory ciuill war clemency purchased great honour victory caesar resolution knowne rome troubled pompey amazed senat terrified common people would bee tedious relate prouisions made pompey much deceiued hee could beleeue caesar would thrust pompey error presuming much self great danger hee bee able raise sufficient force resist success proued otherwise notwithstanding authority consul senate leuie souldiers call home legion send captain defense diuerse city italie whereas caesar passe yet sufficient resist caesar fury power brought fame coming increasing daily pompey whole senat abandoned rome going capua thence brundusium seatown vpon confines italie seated mouth gulf venice gaue order consul passe dirrachium called durrazzo seatown macedonie whereof great part called albania vnite force beeing hope able resist caesar italie already taken corfinium haue formerly said hauing drawn domitivs cohort serue hee marcht hearing pompey consul together brundusium went towards legion speed hee could pompey fortified sufficiently make defense yet vpon caesar approach beginning inuest town imbarkt night time past ouer dirrachium consul attended thus caesar remained italie without resistance doubtfull resolue although would gladly haue followed pompey yet prouision ship reason winter shipping could come soon requisite considering withall much imported leaue enemy behinde might cause alteration france italie absence resolued deferre pursuit pompey take way towards spain held pompey best legion two captain petreivs afranivs svetonivs tranqvillvs saith hee thus resolued said friend let v first go army without captain afterwards let v return captain hath neuer army souldiers pompey spain valiant long trained vp arm commander petreivs afranivs held politick expert war contrary pompey wise valiant captain souldiers newly leuied small experience returning brundusium sixty day without bloudshed battell caesar becam caesar seized rome italie lord italie coming rome great fear remembring cruelty committed time sylla caesar vsing accustomed clemency hurt man degree high lowe called senate senator remained came comforting euery one milde good word laying whole fault vpon pompey accusing thing hapned discord sought mean justifie owne cause declared much euer desired peace therewith requested embassador might sent pompey procure causing presently great lvcan also affirmeth thing ended caesar desirous go rome spain like wise discreet captain first took order aswell ciuill gouernment war making choice legion go hee left part troop brundusium way spain comming alreadie caesar going spain petreius afranius knowne afranivs petreivs attended aid friend foure roman legion caesar warres continued many day chiefly neer city lerida beginning caesar great danger much distressed aswell want victual reason winter com annoyed swelling riuers passed many great skirmish conflict two army accident aduentures long bee recounted finally caesar knew make war sort without giuing oportunity come battell brought aduersaries extremity distresse perishing hunger came composition legion able neither offend defend granted liberty depart go whither would performed accordingly petreivs afranivs went pompey part legion would abide caesar leaue listed caesar still perseuering clemency mildnes war ended spring come leaue thing spain subdued passed forward came prouince betica called andaluzia part force leauing commandement armie march whither hee appointed stay marcvs varro pompey lieutenant prouince held one legion good souldiers daring oppose caesar peaceably yeelded vp vnto countrey legion caesar subdued spain pacified command thence hee went cordoua hee called parliament assembly estate prouince wherein among thing treated highly commending cordoueses seuillians taken part writeth marched forward visiting prouince came isle city cales prouiding certain necessary hee took shippes gallies marcvs varro readinesse hee could get embarked leauing qvintvs cassivs foure legion prouince took passage sea taragona sending commandement land legion march thither hauing day taken order prouince hee departed army towards narbona thence marselles yeelded vnto hauing siege assault taking marselles caesar return rome endured many calamity caesar nothing respecting small regard ingratitude city antiquity fame therof would permit violence offred citizen inhabitant leauing sufficient garrison guard commanded legion appointed journies march towards italie necessary guard person others company took passage rome thing succeeding prosperously although captain ill successe caivs antonivs said left dolabella captain nauie ouerthrowne taken prisoner gulf venice octavivs pompey lieutenant ouerthrowe act worthy recommended honour posterity anthonte constrained ship souldiers long boat want seruiceable ship taken stratagem toil pompeians tied rope vnder water one carried almost thousand opitergins young men valiant intangled snare assaulted power whole armie making resistance morning vntill night end opprest multitude enemy seeing mean escape valour incouragement vvlthivs colonel slue one another dolabella likewise oportunity lost seldom recouered rome arriued brundusium haue said notwithstanding legion yet come yet embarked aboord ship hee readinesse many could contain seuen legion choise men recordeth sent commandement comming make haste end join rest remained would speedily send hee departed brundusium called brindez beginning ianuarie crossing sea prosperous weather third day arriued vpon coast macedonia caesar passage gracia pompey pompey intelligence embarking setting people shore despite pompey captain hee commanded ship gallies presently returne brundusium fetch rest armie hee left commanded come war beginning hee presently seized vpon city apollonia called bellona erico driuing thence lvcivs torqvatvs lvcivs straberivs held pompey soon aduertised caesar landing greatest speed possible sending troop neerest hand hee marched towards dirrachium lay victuall munition prouision warres doubting caesar would come surprise truth vain situation thereof made inexpugnable pompey come camp lodged within forlongs one riuer caesar pompey lodge running passed many aduentures skirmish also treaty peace caesar offred accepted pompey much assured neer vnto dyrrachium power caesar daily expecting coming legion staied longer thought ought haue done without thought wisdome come battell beeing much grieued carefull hee resolued person three confident seruants onely secretly embark brigandine passe streight sea fetch thinking bee able perform without knowledge putting execution accordingly passed riuer sea found troubled tempestuous master brigandine knowing carried daring passe would haue returned caesar discouering face reported said afraid friend thou carriest thee caesar fortune master heerwith encouraged striued houldon voyage length force tempest great winde contrary notwithstanding rash aduenture caesar caesar courageous word constrained return vnable passe anie forward vnderstood armie much wondred grieued murmured thereat praising valiant knight wise captain valerivs maximvs recount rash aduenture opinion occasion ivlivs caesar record commentary past within fewe day antonivs arriued foure legion left behinde italie presently returning ship back rest aduentures hapned joyning caesar armie thing set good order like done pompey side passed thing breuity omit vntill neer city dyrrachium whither caesar went determination haue surprised pompey relieue two army lodged themselues one neer daily skirmish slaughter men either partie one day skirmish waxing hot rescue coming either armie came battell wherein successe caesar troop began battell betwixt caesar pompey neer dyrrachium flee could bee made stand intreaties threat till came camp fortified yet abandoned durst defend pompey either think hee imagined flight bee fained deceit ambush supposed done caesar ouerthrowne small toil bee able recouer prosecute victorie neither followed charge rather caused retreit bee sounded without assailing enemy camp whither caesar came took order conuenient lesse courageous politick time aduersity prosperity reported said friend truely day ended warres enemy captain knowne haue ouercome day ivlivs caesar lost great number souldiers amongst foure hundred romane knight ten tribune two thirty centurion enemy took two thirty ensignes battell ended pompey sent newes thereof diuerse part pompey vanity world houlding absolutely victorious ivlivs caesar hauing blamed captain ensignebearers notwithstanding whole armie grieued ashamed late loss desired battell yet would fight armie timorous inheart victorious rather took new course sending sick hurt men city apollonia hee departed night greatest silence could place took way towards thessalia intent refresh encourage armie draw enemie seacoast chief force lay camp fortified victualled least go meet ouerthrowe scipio hee aduertised came join pompey pompey seeing caesar departure hee followed fewe dayes took counsell appianvs testifieth determined leauing sufficient nauie sea caesar able make benefit thereof passe italie recouer france spain afterwards return caesar beeimportuned ouerruled roman lord came altered determination presently departed pursue caesar made stay field pharsalia thessalia making retreit discretion good order occasion offred euer better vntill length seeing men full resolution force courage resolued longer forbear fight therefore cared refuse battell rather daily presented pompey knowing indeed true caesar began want victual armie began weaken diminish deferred would fight wise wellexperimented captain would haue prolonged war defeating enemie without putting armie hazard although pompey thus resolued yet opinion murmuring importunity preuailed much lvcan plvtarch caesar report made yeeld giue battell euen contrary owne opinion wherein joined one side flower pompey fought contrary owne opinion force rome although caesar force fewer number writer affirm pompey armie twice great yet men actiue better trained many one side cannot certifie author doo much differ among themselues therein appianvs setteth diuerse opinion held thereof raise number three hundred thousand men whereof lvcivs florvs one others threescore ten thousand set somewhat lesse among plvtarch saith pompey brought battell men whereof horseback ivlivs caesar two twenty thousand foot horse fewe one thousand appianvs vnderstandeth lesser number army vnderstood roman onely force hope general likely nation small number war long prepensed importance opinion likely true howsoeuer battell best captain best souldiers aswell experience force valour euer world yet much fought owne use like many place iland octavian come hee sent next day speake greatly complayning proceeding rule command equalitie intolerable either coveting ile sicilia particularly himselfe fell variance octavianvs made navie draw neere shore army beganne stand upon guard one many message complaint passed betweene end although met spake together yet could agree octavian much discord betweene lepidus octavianus beloved better esteemed men warre many vertues nobilitie name sake remembrance ivlivs caesar dissension much grieve one part laid fault lepidvs octavian understood would fall farre take armes practised secretly sundrie lepidvs armie gift promise drew well effected device hee one day great troope horseman roade neere lepidvs campe singling himselfe companie hee began parley souldiers complaining laying fault like ensue upon lepidvs heard many began come side lepidvs advertised hereof commanded alarme given sally skirmished beginning octavian danger continued long part lepidvs troupe passed octavian lepidvs could containe seing himselfe danger abandoned whole armie last refuge yeelded himselfe caesar power putting robe general went tent submitted himselfe unto octavianvs humbly intreating pardon octavian received never offended courteously honourably restored neither estate power sent rome well accompanied entertained without magistracy office dignity highest priest onely ever held death ivlivs caesar whose quarrell ended without battaile bloodshed feared would brought danger ruine octavianvs caesar remained lord sicilia depriving lepidvs triumvirat appropriated himselfe province africa remained general three army viz lepidvs armie pompey owne wherein appianvs lepidus deprived province africa affirmeth legion footman horse well armed besides many light horseman numidian seemeth incredible considereth great part world commanded levied affirmeth also exceeding great assembly men war sea upon coast gallies greater number ship foists brigandine although octavianvs great force yet would hee pursue send pompey said fled suspect supposing marcvs antonivs would harboured succoured glad occasion might offered quarrell man living eyesore unto else himselfe said afterwards pompey none conspired caesar death purposing disperse force returne rome paid souldiers giving coronet honour armes performed notable exploit warres given many gift made many fayre promise legion pardoning captaines souldiers followed pompey best manner could paying contenting lepidvs company sent home house notwithstanding scandal mutiny pacified brought good order leaving sicilie sending africa pretor governor tooke way towards rome received ovation little lesse tryumph incredible joy honour began beloved esteemed many place erected temple altar unto god hee reformed neither sent hee left rome therefore continually advised urged goe husband conceive occasion fall plvtarch observes life antony well entertained understanding device intent prevent controversy might arise betweene husband brother departed rome bearing many jewel present gathered together present marcvs antonivs velleivs patercvlvs reportes fixed heart upon clopatra wrote upon way shee stay returned rome sorrowfull forsaken whereunpon octavian began openly complaine marcvs antonivs shew himselfe enemy marcvs antonivs desire entred league amity king medes asia causing cleopatra besides gave title king alexander armenia parthinia meant conquer ptolomy cilicia phoenicia many cause vvere offered hatred betvveene octavian apparant warre yet deferred octavian hindred war illyricu whome galleyes followed woundred durst stay long vnfortunate marcvs antonivs life time shamefull slight marcus antonius valiant worthie captaine day metamorphosed cleopatra seeing galley flie whereon otherwise next day morning againe salied forth intent fight standing vpon high ground looking towards sea hee sawe nauie gallies moued made towards octavian fleete thought done resolution fight speech one discourse called lord hee commanded vse word insolencie presumption since time hath encreased dayes seemed pride emperour bee hee never base presumeth deserveth like discretion tiberivs shew word also proper god thing appertaining fained also patience meekenesse although senate passed matter contrary opinion affaire gaine said yet seemed way displeased offended therewith understanding spake ill murmuring used reproachfull speech hee shewed discontentment alteration thereat said free citie men tongue ought bee free men might lawfully speake freely wheras senate would exhibited information proceeded written defamatorie libells would consent thereto saying little imployment lose time matter affirming hee would doe nothing spake ill trouble keeping account hee said sufficient satisfie love little loved first tiberivs shewed great respect senate gave great authority thing nothing without counsell willing bee done advice consent execution justice governement hee made many good beginning taking care order theeves robber high wayes side italie men might travell safetie justice bee executed townes village ensignes pretorian cohort rome emperor guard pretorian cohort emperor guard fained vertues tiberius ease citizen guest trouble made encampe lodge without citie field continue abide although seemed profitable yet afterwards bred great inconvenience prejudice meanes onely dissembled covered crueltie pride ambition hee double false hearted even avarice covetousnesse seemeth bee apparant passion incontinencie loosenesse could maske time seemed bee way touched vice governours province gave notice meanes encrease rent revenue hee answered good shepheard speech good pastor minde wolfe ought sheare flocke flay abated tribute shewed favour certaine particular person loose life sought cover ordaining publike informer dishonest adulterous matron rome afterwards appeared end adulterer himselfe thing brevitie omit seemed spring good roote intent failed end fauned bite drew backe charge againe greater force wee hereafter declare part whole cannot bee related mentioned filthinesse thereof occasion order stile cannot observed fitting certainely disordered obscure life cannot bee cleerely orderly written besides used wife ivlia cruelly disgracefully forgetting dowrie enjoyed romane empire hee never lived kept company death octavian one first signes hee shewed evill prince governour notwithstanding came great complaint proconsul pretor prefect sent province yet would remove contrary order custome rome predecessor octavian atrributed carelesnesse others held proceed malice ill disposition end many men enjoy honor profit grew charge began envie malice germanicvs preferred sonne drvsvs grieved see good successe warres germanie wherefore finde occasion remoove charge hee dissemblingly caused triumph granted unto victory obtained wrote many time come tryumph germanicvs understanding evill intent deferred comming happened within king parthian tooke armes made warre romane empire breaking peace confirmed time octavian entring province armenia king whereof inuested romanes wherewith tiberivs nothing displeased supposing thereby haue better occasion draw germanicvs charge gouernment germanie vnder colour send parthian warres germanicvs sent came purpose hauing day wonne great germanicus sent parthian battaile slaine tenne thousand enemy entred rome solemne triumph cornelivs tacitvs reporteth hee brought thither ensignes qvintilivs varro lost presently began prepare warre parthian little germanicvs triumph arose man italie called clemens bondslaue agrippa named agrippa nephew octavian haue said slaine tiberivs order action seemed importance much loose seditious people ioyned caused great tumult italie man went make warre germanie whither tooke iourney whereto added ordinarie legion part shew appearance doe great exploite armie passed riuer rhine began make warre time seemed men considering conquest vaine war caligula great number men resolution wherewith came would haue ouerrunne world haue made great conquest contented himselfe king son batauia called holland disgrace father came batauia holland seruice herewith hauing done small harme countrie returned passed riuer giuen alarmes tooke way armie towards sea memorie victorie commaunded tower built souldiers gather abundance cockle shelles spoyles enemy calling armie together manner captaines vse doe notable victorie made long oration vnto commended afterwards commaunded great money distributed amongst ouer aboue pay returning rome sent commaund prepared solemne triumph carrying effect certaine barbarian enemy could get afterwards altered determinatio deferring triumph vntil another time entred rome ouacian triumph began againe execute accustomed cruelty purposing haue done greater world vnable endure many conspired therein first began practise tribune pretorian cohort whose name cherea died thirtie wound caligula murthered manner gaue vault secret gallerie wherein vsed passe vnseene palace certaine bathe hauing vnworthily raigned three yeeres ten moneths nine twentith yeere age manner death besides svetonivs death making shew verie sorrie said would god could write word though proceeded pittifull inclination maister seneca second booke clemencie doth highly praise extol entertained like manner men vvrite persvvaded thereto letter ivlivs vindex vvho novv said vvas armes france newes spaine emperor nrro much troubled hee lien good though dead without speaking one word rose vp man desperate tearing clothes knocked head walles demanding receiuing counsell comfort would haue giuen furie past began take order leuying force require succor aide much hated world man came willingly seruice rather perswading one another contrarie thing standing state nero busied himselfe leuying army discoursing himselfe cruelty punishment hee might inflict came certaine newes vnto legion lay vpon frontier high germanie whose captaine rvfvs virginivs also armes well france spaine newes nero lost courage hope defend himselfe senate people rome therewith much troubled without leader meere motion common consent determined nero despaires himselfe abandon nero refuse yeeld obedience whereof ensued death shamefull vile deserued manner svetonivs writeth newes came insurrection legion nero dinner presently heard threw table ground despair defend himselfe taking certaine poison boxe gold withdrew himselfe certain garden deuised sundrie way meanes escape present calamitie sometime thinking flie italie king parthia great league friendship euer nce coronation brother tiridates king armenia otherwhiles thought yeeld himselfe sergivs galba craue mercy hand finding helpe remedie either repaired vnhim came calling opinion goe forth publike place assembly rome clad mourning attire craue pardon ill forepassed life grant continue empire yet least would bestow vpon nero brought extreame miserie gouernment kingdome egypt effect found certain oration already drawne closet durst put deuice practise fearing slaine people great already tumult citie passing day part night doubt feares laid himselfe vpon bed although hee tooke little rest determining himselfe next day put execution counsell seeme profitable hauing slept little awoke midnight giuen vnderstand cohort guard palace gone forsaken amazed great alteration sent certaine best confident friend house betweene wicked men true friendship neither due neither deserued none hee receiued good answere wherfore seruants protected darkenes night went forth palace person went many house none would open doores neither giue answere hee within day feared adored world returned sorrowfull despised feare men returning lodging whence came found ransackt spoild euen boxe poison reserued last refuge saw despair life desiring die began great hast call certain sword player serued whose name spicillvs mirmilon commanded kill neither man neither would doe cried loud voice saying perceiue haue neither friend enemie furie went determination drowne riuer tiber making stand asked might hide vntill bethought doe presently enfranchised man named faon offered keepe secretly hidden farme mile rome nero taking last refuge mounting horsback barefooted shirt wastcoate old sullied ouerworne cloake cast vpon holding handkerchief face darke night hee went rome foure men beare company couert disguised manner possibly could great feare trouble came village vvhither carried leauing horsehidden among certaine tree vvent couertly certaine cane reedes hee came house vvhither hee vvas goe faon vvhich brought counselled goe caue vsed dig sand whereto answered hee would burie himselfe aliue end went house creeping foure hole made wall coming chamber cast himselfe vpon poore bed hungrie thirstie desired haue something eate nothing peece browne bread little water bread would eate dranke water wonderfull feare sorrow see himselfe place thing passed nero haue said soone day flight presently discouered senate assembled common consent hee adiudged enemy vnto countrie condemned die commanded sought euery senate send seeke nero execution whereof men war pretorian vrban cohort consented perswasions promise made vnto newes determination senate published seruant said faon brought nero farme went rome giue vnderstand thereof knew secret way come emperour hee found making preparation kill perswasion came seeing meanes escape hearing sorrowfull newes doome giuen senate enemy state punished maiorum hereupon demanded kinde punishment maiorum hee vnderstood man condemned stript naked head set fast stock bodie scourged rod death terrified therewith hee took poiniards brought thither feeling point edge hee made shew doe counselled growing fearefull coward hee put againe sheath faining fatall houre yet come sometimes prayed intreated one kill end might follow example time would reproue base minde want courage vntill last hearing noise certain horseman commandement senate came seeke set poinyard throate wherewith helpe one seruants wounded himselfe wound within little hee died making nero slew himselfe gesture countenance made present amazed thereat ended enemy mankinde venom poison earth pliny calleth ruled empire fourteene yeeres age two thirtie yeeres seuentith yeere birth iesvschrist nero man goodly captaines treate thereof peace pardon graunted well men armie ouercome neere bebriaco came obedience vitellivs absence like done part senate came otho modena rome death otho known flavivs sabinvs pompe pride soldier city passed committing many disorder insolencies german legion italy grown proud victorie obtained vvere author vitellivs empire committed outrage neuer seene heard countrie vvhereof spoil losse vvhich people sustained vvas inestimable tacitvs svetonivs report vitellivs coming full pride victorie italy either could vvould remedie disorder sort might seem doe iustice shevv himselfe iusticer caused pretorian cohort vvhich actor death galba making otho emperour disarmed depriued name honor souldiers commaunded armes bee taken one hundred twentie guiltie condemned death sought found iust sentence executed vpon proceeded iust iudge vitellivs thus marching towards rome desired see place captaines obtained victorie otho armie fortie day field lay full dead body yet vnburied many could endure euill smell thereof cruell tyrant reprooued saying sweeter sent world smell enemie dead especially citizen cruell speech vitellius speech doubtlesse inhumane cruell written abhorred ought read like affection vitellivs come rome vpon way many scandal outrage co mitted sundrie nation came infinite robbery spoiles done countrey entry citie fearefull terrible entred enemy countrey beene conquered mounted vpon great horse clad militarie warlike habiliment senate people rome going though vitellius entrie rome triumphed ouer compassed standard eagle sundrie ensignes whole army foot horse armed best armour furniture could gotten manner went capitoll make prayer ivpiter afterwards went manner palace next day commanding senate assembled came thither made fit speech vespasian dead eldest sonne titvs called surname vespasianvs without contradiction receiued obeyed emperor wel father lifetime made companion empire author say participate gaue name emperor also testament last hee appointed successor yet brother domitianvs proudly maintained father nominated brother titvs father falsified titvs excellent emperor raign short lasted little titus endued noble vertues two yeers naturall bounty noble disposition called loue delight mankinde although hee emperour taxed vpon occasion imagining hee would haue proued wicked peruerse truth vertue although time may bee suppressed yet length preuail ouercome enuy slander cleer sun disperseth dark cloud titvs cleer suspicion conceiued brightnes vertues worthy action came empire age yeers somewhat le followed warres gat great experience peace war first infancy brought learning vertuous exercise therby grew learned greek latin expert many art good horseman skilfull musick good singer eloquent orator could make verse wonderfull ease facility singular memory endued excellent wit speedie writing cipher abbreuiations excelled secretary notary would well counterfeit man hand writing said might haue notable romane empire time emperour domitian traian went warres made traian king dacia warre exceeding great army king dacia named decevalvs leuied defence force power great war cruel king dacia way able defend himselfe determined come battaile wherein traiane victorie exceeding great losse enemy little romanes battaile cruell bloudie victorie obtained traian following chase enemy pursued hard deceualus demand peace traian decevalvs despaire sent humbly desiring peace offering accept condition prescribe traian took great glory pardoning humble meeke taming subduing proud hautie taken head striken brought severvs man may well beleeue little ioyfull saw considering little wounded cast ground men accounted dead enemy victorious escaping saw himselfe absolute lord enemy confounded wherefore let euery christian reader consider inconstant thing life man neither ought repose assured confidence thing world great cruelty severvs committed obtained victorie truly prince died yeer yeer lord life heliogabalvs onely name fift called antonini fovre twentith emperovr rome argvment heliogabalus priest sunne attaining empire soon hee taken imperiall dignity became wicked filthinesse far surpassed predecessor dishonest life befitted lasciuious intemperate man addicted woman granted hould senate themselues neer sea would eat meat bred far within land farre would eat nothing seafish neither would hee eat thing excessiue price inclined kinde vertue neither regarded parasite russian bawd like person action abominable riotousnes great write amasse heap villany made bracelet souldiers girdle like thing maximinvs newly come army could scarcely speake latine tongue vulgar romane speech came emperour intreated giue leaue try himselfe exercise emperor meruailing vnmeasurable proportion person seeing faire well proportioned granted request vpon condition encounter contend roman souldier waterbearers seruitors camp among many valiant strong men maximinvs comming handy gripe ouercame greatest strength sought purpose without resting taking breath moued victorie emperor caused iewels small price giuen vsually giuen souldiers commanded also receiue pay entered muster role serue souldier vpon day emperor riding view camp hee saw maximinvs yet raw souldier order wherefore willed coronell call rank instruct duty ought obserue war maximinvs imagining emperor spake came kneeled foot emperor desiring pastime see whether could runne well spurred horse gaue sundry turn field seeing maximinvs euer kept euen horse tired running afoot shewed signe wearinesse hee rained footemanship maximinus horse asked maximinvs whether could wrestle whereto answered would wrestle long please majesty emperor maruelling strength made choice certain strongest men army wrestle maximinvs without breathing resting ouercame seuen whereupon septimivs severvs commanded collar gold bee giuen vnto certain peeces siluer made one guard commanded hee attend palace mean came much esteemed among coronels men warre daily increased stature strength came camp hee boy sometime wrestling would ouerthrowe twenty thirty strongest men army battels encounter euer bare away prize chiefest honour performing strange thing wherfore severvs fauoured much gaue good place charge war eat drink according proportion body rather capitolinvs writes daily vse eat pound waight among thing permitted chuse censor pleasure antient magistracy great authority office correct manner customes reforme abuse disorder people therefore supreme iurisdiction ouer men office time rome came commanded one head emperor vsurped made themselues censor whereupon senate chose said valerianvs censor notwithstanding hee absent moreouer without valerianus made censor senate senat chose yong decius caesar father successor request made decivs nominated sonne whose name also decivs caesar successor liued city one yeer gouerning thing great wisdome equity aduice consent senate great contentment roman people excepting christian commonwealth hee blinde man made generall edict decree whereby commanded bee slain persecuted evsebivs writeth whereas goth time inuading thracia misia subdued greatest part prouinces decivs determined person make head carrying sonne hee left gouernment hand senate leuying new force marched gothes coming battell decius gothe legion within fewe day joined battell although doubtfull yet end hee victorie slue thirty thousand constraining rest flie mountaines place hard accesse daring come plaines brought extremitie easily ruined beene betrayed shall heare king gothes sent word would giue leaue quietly depart would abandon land returne countrie emperour hauing taken passage imagining might easily kill take prisoner punish breach peace granted time balbinvs would yeeld king request hauing brought streight could escape hand gaue charge notable captaine whose name trebonianvs gallvs roman gentleman gouernor frontier misia keepe certiane passage gothes might passe effect gaue command great number souldiers hauing desire make emperor mean vsed onely discharged office wherein imploied ill gaue secret intelligence king gothes would let passe aduising therewith diuide army two part one half trebonianus gallus betraied decius cause death wherof lay ambush assault emperor camp mistrusted matter faining fear flee back draw emperour ambush might safety kill contract made effect followed writeth pomponivs letvs iornandes relateth another manner yet author agree treason captain gallvs emperor decivs came battell gothes great aduantage wherein notwithstanding battell betwixt decius gothes hee souldiers fought valiantly yet sonne therein ended liues iornandes writeth man could well judge victory yong decivs mortally wounded arrow hee fell horse sight father emperor loud voice called souldiers willing dismaid death one knight would bee hinderance commonwealth gen rous speech vsed decius seeing son mortally wounded fall ground miserable death decius neither battell end foreseeing ruine gothes apparantly victory end would fall enemy hand clapt spur horse giuing head leapt deep lake water thereby wherin waight armour soon drowned body neuer found gothes following victory made great slaughter roman army put rout escaped fled legion wch trebonianvs gallvs commanded confederat gothes safety sought reuenge find breuitie vsed author seeke rather briefly set downe naked truth beautifie historie fiction haue seene men doe purpose beginning hath briefe properly write historie sum abbridgment history containing liues emperor whereof write largely shall seeme expedient although time whereof write historiographer wrote negligently obserued little order man hardly draw little writing treate life posthvmvs speaking tyrant avreolvs wee made mention valerianvs highly honour esteem cause sonne gallienvs held great reputation soone came empire sent sonne saloninvs hee intituled caesar bee brought vp instructed afterwards seeing neglect ill gouernment father galienvs forgetting loyaltie ought soueraigne lord putting sonne death sought get empire himselfe yet others write hee prouoked compelled inhabitant countrie hated galienvs accept name emperor slew saloninvs scorning haue boy lord howsoeuer posthvmvs great courage discretion saloninus son galienus put death posthumus also called emperor made himselfe lord france gouerned space seuen yeeres defending valiantly obtaining many great victory barbarian northern nation continually inuaded made cursions posthvmvs galienvs leuied armie neere italie notwithstanding vicious carelesse yet wanted ot sufficient courage warres would haue followed pleasure ease went posthvmvs hauing generall armie noble man called theodotvs also another called clavdivs man great probitie vertue afterwards emperour come citie wherein posthvmvs frenchman onely defend citie shewing great courage loue emperor galienvs skirmish wounded arrow meanes whereof hee constrained rayse siege holding doubtfull warre made peace avreolvs time called emperour slauonia sufficient defeat posthvmvs supported victorinvs excellent captaine yong man posthvmvs made companion manner hapned many great accident constantivs part dioclesian maximinian emperor constantivs caesar followed warres galerivs began warre lesse dangerous narsevs king persia haue said went besides continued long many men slaine eyther side without aduantage hope victory either party vntill last came whole power set battaile neere city carras galerivs caesar entred lesser force hee ought haue done requisite fighting greater courage discretion hee ouerthrowne losing almost whole armie escaped flight wherat emperor dioclesian much grieued galerivs coming presence mesopotamia meeting vpon way himselfe ouerthrowne battaile end gaue leaue depart inoyning leuie new armie endeuor recouer lost honor defend prouince galerivs parting much ashamed diligence put execution dioclesian remaining troups mesopotamia meane time end persian inuade galerivs speede second battail galerius persian went europe leuie souldiers bringing legion slauonia dacia misia returned asia went greater armenia whither narsevs king persian ouerthrowne already come hee beganne warre againe good order good aduice lesse courage two army came neere one mutuall consent general ioyned battaile one presuming victorie past preserue honor gotten recouer loss souldiers reason fought galerius victorie persian incredible courage resolution made battaile cruell bloudie romane armie consisting choise men better trained obtained victorie without great difficultie danger king escaped flight galerivs following execution entred camp found great rich tooke wiues child sister many noble principall men kingdome persia marching forward force inuaded countrie great spoile therein finding man durst make resistance thence went mesopotamia see dioclesian receiued triumph dioclesian himselfe went meete entertained embraced cheerefully great honor matter east pacified persian parthian ouerthrown hauing therin spent many yeers returned europe maximinianvs called hercvlevs emperor companion constantivs caesar busied war recited truth gouerned directed wisedome dioclesian whose valour policie courage durst disobay equall maximinianvs seemed son captain rather emperor companion men held empire peace three part wit east west south northerly part could neuer throughly subdued well fierceness courage valor ouerthrown put flight withdrew themselues cold barren inaccessible place could well indure born vnder climate roman captaines held impossible passe army contenting themselues haue chased bound empire would afterwards returne furie first euer troublesom feared scythian goth sarmates alans carpus catti quades barbarous nation rose empire nation great number assembling themselues desire rob steale inhabit fertile soile began make war great spoile territory empire emperor two caesar marched army dispersing themselues sundrie part followed war although without losse great difficultie one helping assisting end obtained victorie barbarous nation repulsed many thousand taken prisoner afterwards set libertie certain pro ce war dispeopled giuen inhabit dioclesian hauing obtained victorie many hauing settled peace empire industrie maximinianvs companion empire galerivs constantivs caesar willing enioy accustomed reward victory came rome entred triumph together emperor maximinianvs two caesar aforesaid dioclesians umph made vnto one stately triumph euer seene rome wherein infinite masse treasure spoile east egypt nation subdued chariot full arm vessel gold siluer also wereled prisoner wife child king persia many king captaines sundrie army alanes catti others eighteenth yeer raign dioclesian long time busied war prouiding giuing order thing done therin dioclesian wise politick valiant gouernment empire emperor either held empire like subjection maximinianvs obeyed father kisse raising vp gaue peace lip cheeke meane men vsed kisse knee dioclesian commanded publike edict without difference men kisse foote prostrate vpon earth greater reuerence made shooes set pearle discipline church began bee corrupt feruent deuotion began wax cold enuie contention growing bishop discord among conceiueth god justly suffer persecution happened truth cruell tongue able expresse wherefore well saith evsebivs present saw hee cannot thoroughly expresse wordes hee saw eye hee pavlvs orosivs write thing qualitie heart hard haue compassion bee grieued heare haue written wonderfull consider patience constancie persecuted rage crueltie persecuted generall dioclesian endeuoured destroy church temple christian end assemble pray vse diuine seruice hee burnt bookes could get holy delicate woman strong constant faith hanged vp feete naked borne end life continue space shame double torment others eares nose lip hand finger feete cut hauing onely eye left greater orment afterwards took name emperor hee woman soria called evtropia one daughter named favsta maried constantyne son constantivs caesar afterwards emperor life constantivs clorus first name galerivs comely goodly constitution body notwithstanding condition great difference betwixt yet dioclesian great wisdome made liue peace concord way disagreed dead wise men fear fall agreed lot diuide prouinces empire constantivs befell italie sicilia africa prouinces thereof together france spain germanie britannie galerivs empire diuided constantius galerius allotted slauonia macedonia thracia described emperor galerivs vnderstood heerof hee commanded severvs caesar speed take way towards rome new tyrant maxentivs incamped neer city greatest part armie nouelties euer pleasing went ouer maxentivs father maximinianvs lucania renounced empire vnderstanding desire rule came great haste rome vnder pretext counsell assist son gouernment sent dioclesian desiring like wee haue said would mention proueth death sonne crispvs made caesar wife favsta haue sayd maxentivs sister many noble eminent men cannot certainly said fell ou thereby condemne excuse emperour man hee might fall sinnes yet afterwards acknowledging errour might aske mercie god hand offence true say put son crispvs death wife favsta mother law said sonne complained would haue rauished whereas contrarie dishonestly sought procuring loue dishonest constantine put wife sonne n phew death companie whereto loyall dutifull childe would consent truth whereof afterwards knowne constantine caused slaine great reason alexander man great holinesse learning gentle mild condition endeuoured beginning haue cured arrivs heretical infirmity soft gentle medicament praying admonishing leaue errour misbeliefe holy speech greater humility emperor constantine became christian church obtayned libertie authoritie thereof confirmed rich yet certaine time also many holy men although afterwards generally great sincerity holiness life yet neither emperor rich gaue blamed euill disposition condition vse thereof abuse beleeued ancient holie men beginning primitiue church would reason rich forbeare haue holy deuout neither assured afterwards proud insolent would haue holy deuout notwithstanding poore true acknowledge voluntarie pouertie state great perfection great rich oftentimes minister occasion pride wickednesse hereof men themselues cause naturally inclined euill put execution rich haue greater power poore therefore neither rich pouerty occasion neither rich men wicked neither poore men good would rich occasion thereof neither rich pouertie owne nature good euill rather saith pavl thing cleane cleane neither ought rich contemned wicked man doth abuse wealth argument force likewise bee condemned despised strength bodie beautie countenance sharpenesse wit quicknesse vnderstanding man desire vgly feeble dull ignorant little discretion strong faire beautifull quickwitted great capacitie vnderstanding may doe harme vse greater deceite deformed decrepit ignorant man shall judge according occasion pouerty bringeth little care great distrust therewith men become enuious greedily couetous malefactor coueting stealing men good yet denie rich greater danger fault v good themselues neither good euill hath vse swarue history conclude say let v forbeare blame constantine blame haue abused misspent good giuen constantine let zealous generall reformation church reforme owne conscience amend owne liues abuse let teares pray vnto god amend rest euery man particular would sarmatian warres marcellvs pebervs excellent captain great experience himselfe passed slauonia towards east notwithstanding great armie yet marcellus peberus sent constantius sarmates free fear emperor euer preuailed ciuill warres tyrant persian euer vnfortunate wherefore practised come composition peace sapor second name king persia raigned refused giue eare ambassador motioned whereof sapor growing beyond measure proud wrote hautie letter constantivs answer thereto marcellinvs sett wherein required lib tenor letter written sapor king persia emperor constantius answer thereto effect constantius letter sapor emperor would haue peace first resign hand prouinces mesopotamia armenia subiect ancestor great power presumption king persia would grant peace truce roman emperor except would giue two best prouinces world letter constantivs sent another answer notable letter discreet breuity insert wherein held grauity maiesty roman emperor reprehending sapor pride ambition denied required also put clean hope haue peace afterwards began cruell war time matter passed east ivlianvs remained france caesar generall german victory subdued enemy great bloudy battell hauing obtained notable victory generall consent whole armie called emperor avgvstvs made equall iulianus armie made emperor augustus constantivs newes within fewe day brought constantivs east wherewith much disquieted resolued haue abandoned warres haue marched legion ivlianvs afterwards altering determination resolued send ambassador vnto thinking good word win sent perswade content title dignity caesar constantius sent ambassador iulianus renounce name emperor avgvstvs ambassage sent chief man whose name leonas came constantivs honourably receiued army audience giuen hauing deliuered ambassage emperor letter read armie onely refused yeeld thereto one voice confirmed done calling ivlianvs emperour avgvstvs onely obeyed constantivs putting florentinvs office pretorian prefect giuen nebridivs touching rest ivlianvs answered constantivs humble manner best word hee could promising iulianus answer constantius loyall obedient companion desiring hee would depose dignity seeing accepted thereof thereto compelled armie heerwith returned make war german greater force circumspection foreseeing requisite tame subdue nation imagining haue war could auoid constantivs aduised captain troop make haste assail enemy assailed whereupon ensued germanes notable battails encounter cannot relate without altering ordinarie course breuitie constantivs vnderstood ambassador could obtain hee required resolued make war ivlianvs presuming great power good fortune euer tyrant wherefore hee sought meanes confirm peace friendship question arsaces king armenia king east end ioin league confederacy king persia chiefest enemy hee left force thought sufficient defend countrey continue war came europe trauelling antioch syria city tharsus way hee felt somewhat ill light feuer yet notwithstanding held journey thinking exercise would haue holpen diuerting humour therefore caused carried litter making small journies coming foot mount taurus felt much oppressed disease feuer increasing vpon sort hee seemed fire knowing infirmity mortall death approched made wherein nominated ivlianvs enemie tyrant constantius last testament heir successor man life time would admit companion death hee chose heir hauing action good emperor great regard common good quiet empire emperor raigned foure twenty yeers seuen brother seuenteen alone although contention tyrant aforenamed father time caesar death constantius thirteen yeers wherefore say raigned eight thirty yeers hee died saith evtropivs fiue forty yeers old yet author agree heerupon emperor reckoned among indifferent emperor notwithstanding endowed singular gift yet altogether free vice courteous milde pleasing conuersation liberall affable seruants temperate eating drinking would take great pain delighted desired much speak well yet naturally neither sharpwitted eloquent excellent archer delighted greatly therein hee otherwise credulous delighted hear men speak euill others moued commit many cruelty nature mistrustfull euer feared treason therefore trusted fewe men likewise much giuen woman vice vertues well preserued defended roman empire died according ieroms computation yeer lord life ivlianvs name called apostata six fortith emperovr rome death constantivs hapned declared cofen germane ivlianvs remained sole emperor whole roman empire others life time enjoyed title avgvstvs ivlianvs birth haue specified life constantivs valour sufficiency one best emperor euer presently make manifest good grace corrupted defaced renouncing christian faith whereof made profession turning idolatry gentils wherefore commonly called ivlianvs apostata whereof author say one li anivs idolater famous rhetorician occasion besides reason may bee heerto annexed notable example prince men estate condition whatsoeuer onely diligence seeke master sonnes may expert science wherein purpose instruct principally vertuous honest sound men religion learning without vertue little worth certaine child learne youth imprinted vnderstandings neuer forget exercise quality wherein bred vp tender age become proper naturall neuer left whole life time whereof master haue charge child principal cause although might produce many good fair example yet present shall suffice returning ivlianvs master infidelitie took deep impression well appeareth prejudice hee thereby receiued rest hee compleat rare goodnes bounty courtesie compare titvs clemency antoninvs iulianus compared fortunate stratagem war germanes make equall traian temperance modestie marcvs avrelivs knowledge learning ancient philosopher endued singular memory studious therefore learned many art science eloquent well spoken lesse gift nature art temperate dyet sleep chaste free fleshly passion dishonestie hee valiant hardie armes although small constitution body delicately limmed hee therefore noted reproued hardy aduenturous generall emperor fit conuenient glory renowne hee greedily couetous vice wherein great spirit oftentimes offend friend pleasant bountifull loued justice indifferently men strictly obserued time caesar small time enjoied empire likewise adorned many vertues evtropivs eywitnes avrelivs victor ammianvs marcellinvs doo record hee infidell great pity vnderstanding blinded perswasion master libanivs iulianus idolater perswasion schoolmaster gentile idolater thing passed time caesar emperor largely particularly described ammianvs marcellinvs saw vnderstood hapned time also followed serued war persia relate onely happened hee emperor briefly raigned onely two yeers wherefore hold fit raign small continuance spend much time aduertised death constantivs newes brought france whence go meet haue said comming towards resolution great haste hee marched city constantinople euer since death emperor constantine head empire mean possible sought win loue good people nation better bring passe hee vsed policie first hee caused temple iulianus made temple idolater opened gentile set open suffred therein commit superstitious idolatry adore idol although abhorred enemy christian yet time persecuted death torture contention christian arrians neuter shewing inclined neither partie wherefore hatefull barbarous nation standing fear great fame reason german war growne famous abstained making warre troubling empire sent ambassador treat peace friendship granted manner hee began gouern empire great prosperity contentment men euer man heart hee idolater hee resolued finde mean supplant true christian religion induced thereto diuell owne wickednes better effect practised mean neuer vsed mean vsed iulianus persecute church induce gift fauours flattery bestowing office dignity end renounce christian faith sacrifice false god author affirme new deuice found iulianus persecute church couetous ambitious desire grow rich honoured denied christian faith one greatest persecution euer church endured aswell respect abandoned ivlianvs perceiued meane could throughlie accomplish desire although said put none death neither vsed violence therefore made lawes generall decree christian decree made iulianus christian master art science neither ther studie schooles would adore idol end desire learning become idolater else least remaine idiot without learning insufficient vnable preach christian faith likewise ordeined christian haue charge hold office iustice neither captaine warres neither enioy dignitie finally vsed inuentions meanes could deuise make warre iesvs christ without shedding christian bloud hold inuention subtiltie diuell take crowne holie martyr obteined persecution sword vsing pitifull crueltie christian man courage valiant armes resolued make warre persian onely shewed humilitie acknowledged superioritie wherefore went asia great army ordinarie legion hauing passed asia lesse prouinces entred mesopotamia said lady romanes persian ordinarily contend light encounter skirmish seized vpon citie cercasio fauoured romanes enobled emperour dioclesian wals iulian enterprise aoainst persian bulwarkes thence passed zaita aduertised king persia neere hand whole power whereupon marshalled troupe great desire come battaile enemie time durst fight sent many ambassages intreating pardon promising great part country valiant emperour would giue audience seeing refused battaile prouoke entred countrey sundrie way taking many city soria force others yeelded themselues without resistance committing great spoiles countrey vntill last persian shame forced fight battaile cruell blind ivlianvs orosivs ierome recite malice hatred bare christian called galilean saith theodoretvs historie hee presently ordered reinforced armie could done without great difficulty sapor vnderstanding death ivlianvs noble act great courage generally feared men made small account new emperor gathering contempt said author write great reason said traian extend bound empire theodosivs wholly vanquish gothes recouered countrie beene lost life time hee made serue vassalls romane empire stood free recouered reputation though much toyle danger romane empire neuer honoured better defended spaniard emperor men giue credit bookes let looke present estate empire shall see yeers authoritie greatnesse charles king spaine emperour must vnderstand mexia spaniard borne theodosivs receiued emperor letter accepted charge offered vnto greatest speede could hee went country gothes knowing comming gathered themselues together fight theodosivs desirous thereof hauing first leuied sufficient army taken order made prouision requisite great care circumspection drew neere vnto tried souldiers skirmish encounter came giue battaile one cruell bloudy euer theodosivs carried himselfe discreetely valiantly aswel fighting encouraging directing men obtained victory made incredible slaughter enemy afterwards remainder escaped vntill driuen prouince remained enemy leauing armie good order went doe dutie emperor gratian hungary lay cittie sirmie noble victorie hee well considered vertues worthinesse made emperor avgvstvs equall companion yet say beginning battaile howsoeuer shared empire giuing theodosivs constantinople thracia prouinces east like manner valens held reseruing himselfe italie westward wherein dlso raigned young brother valentinianvs ended gratian presently returned italie thence france theodosivs went make end war feared redoubted nation world aforesaid gothes alanes hunnes people scythia reade alexander great would goe make conquest people feared world alanes tooke name riuer scythia called alane ammianvs marcellinvs saith called auncient time massagetes hunnes also scythian scythia europe inhabiting beyond bogges meotis fierce nation although northerly nation yet rest historie hereafter appeare say day called tartarians people againe entred hungarie theodosivs went fight sometimes one nation sometimes another author write fought many cruell battailes vpper hand slew infinite number escaped sword hee made flie confines empire end hee would ouertire men warre humbly required peace athanaricvs king gothes offering himselfe people doe seruice graunted comming athanaricus king gothes sued theodosius peace athanaricus comming constantinople hee brought answered yet truly goe see penance pastor lay vpon offence went forward vntill came church doore went came ambrose requested absolue permitt come church heare diuine seruice ambrose saw emperor mildely answered come breake lawes neither thy commandement neither passe ouer threshold doore come request thee loose band wherewith thou hast bound thou wilt pray god forgiue sinnes shut doores church god openeth sinner heartily repent repentance hast thou shewed quoth bishop hanious offence salue hast thou healed mortall wound thou quoth emperour art instruct shew ought doe thou shalt see accomplish thou shalt prescribe bishop seeing emperours mildnes thinking sufficient penance excommunicated church space eight moneths faire charitable speech said thy penance theodosivs condemne dye thy successor shall executed within thirtie dayes thou hast pronounced sentence death end thirty dayes thou shalt againe demanded whether thou dost hold thy commandement iust time free passion thou wilt iudge thy selfe whether thou hast iustly iudged theodosivs heard presently commanded law written made proclaimed himselfe obserued life wherof much good ensued law made emperour came made doubt victory assuring obtain lay hand god multitude men horse hauing resolution passe certain port thereby auoid enemie brother considering hardly performed pavlvs orosivs writeth hee made evstachivs plainly expresseth word brute beast haue also endured wrath lord warre city beeing laid waste people thereof put sword like done field lie bare desolate desert whereof prouinces thracia slauonia countrie wherein borne beare true record whereby seemeth nothing remaineth earth aire bush wood rest spoiled destroied humane spoil alaricvs radagasivs resolued come italie diuiding army man much beloued life time great truth accident warres well prosperous vnfortunate haue befaln roman empire space foure hundred yeers little lesse whereof wee haue written reader may easily judge notwithstanding haue sometimes seen distresse troubled danger haue lost whole part yet end although calamity continued space wee haue seen hath bin deliuered danger repairing mean may say hath bin cured infirmity wherwith oppressed recouered loss sustained vntill time whereto wee comn secret judgement god henceforth matter succeeded well loss multiplied force diminished although sometimes valour excellent emperours captain empire striue recouer antient majesty honoured feared yet could neuer attain former also seldom henceforth sundry time diuerse declining roman empire accident emperor lost whole prouinces legion began kingdom particular state country empire lost arose great mightie monarchy principality kingdom multiplied great strange originall kingdom accident hapned cannot relate neither bound thereto purpose intent write generall history onely emperor briefly wherefore briefly shall able lay open groundwork hold way writing thing shall greatest importance history emperours leauing king kingdom process time shall present themselues others either already haue heerafter shall take charge vpon haue already taken hand enough small ability pray god may bee able bring reasonable good end honest satisfaction shall reade death honorivs whole roman empire belong nephew theodosivs sole emperor instant constantinople held eastern empire already said may castinvs ecivs castinvs enemy boniface gouernour africa seeing hee tooke part iohn perswaded declare enemie yet discouered themselues better bring confusion wherefore castinvs fled spaine africk great fleet great number souldiers spreading rumour hee fled thither feare vandales part spaine hee could liue safetie vnder colour whereof writing louing letter bonifacivs setting men land seised many city coast africa liued certaine day counterfeit castinus came boniface africa peace friendship bonifacivs yet boniface free iealousie heereof ther day epistle extant written avgvstine bishop hippo answer thereto discouering suspicion castinvs afterwards manifesting ill meaning avgvstine sought meanes reconcile godly endeuour taking effect fought battaile although castinus ouerthrown battel boniface cruell bloudie castinvs ouerthrowne fled ship souldiers hee could gather together returned shame dishonour sapine iohn vsurping emperour vnderstood hee sent intent leaue lieutenant italy assembling hunnes gothes french germanes spaniard gaules burgonians great number iudgement may recorded greatest fierce battaile euer first attempt get little hill betweene two army either two general thought requisit taken thereby haue aduantage atila sent certaine troups take hill effect thither already thorismvnd sonne theodoricvs come people gothes spaniard hill rest presently gaue charge slaughter cry emperour leo nephew leo discoursed life leo second name sixe fiftith romane emperor father zeno argvment emperor leo dead nephew whose name also leo tooke possession empire seemed matter vnreasonable father whose name zeno liue priuate man emperour wherefore renounced empire vnto crowned owne hand within short space dyed zeno beeing made emperour w dow empresse much displeased enioy great dignity procured basiliscus captaine owne rebell making himselfe emperor compelled zeno flie isauria asia continued long miserie basiliscus hated pride behaued himselfe zeno restored empire whilest liued east peace westerne empire rome turmoiled orestes father emperor augustulus taken prisoner pauia slaine augustulus feare left imperiall ensignes empire rome discretion odoacer afterwards dispossest theodoricus king ostrogothes zeno hauing somewhat troubled warres east hauing obtained victorie two tyrant aspar sonne ardaburius rose dyed ordinary death constantinople raigned sixteene yeeres iam opinion reader hath sufficiently vnderstood estate empire remained emperour leo died constantinople wherefore hold needlesse make repetition thereof say soone leo departed life nephew without contradiction acknowledged obeyed emperor whose name also leo sayd grandfather chosen appointed death hee held empire space certaine moneths end thing seemeth strange breedeth admiration ovvne accord voluntarie free holding hard case father subiect inferior sonne renounced empire gaue father zeno crowned owne hand presently homage father life time leo refused empire gaue father zeno giue child kingdomes dignity thing haue seene often read seemeth reason induce thereto seldome hath man euer heard sonne would dispossesse kingdome empire giue father hath rather happened contrarie sonne hath bereaued father thereof force life time yea sometimes hath wished practised father death heire succeede therefore say accident strange reuerence obedience sonne much noted succeeded manner zeno crowned obeyed emperour constantinople sonne leo remained former estate contrarie hereof italy orestes made sonne avgvstvlvs emperor desiring procuring himselfe leo hauing renounced empire giuen father iornandes author say died within day pavlvs diaconvs reporteth another manner saith father sought sonnes death deliuered making himselfe priest liued certaine yeeres howsoeuer mention made leo father zeno began rule empire going progresse visit chalcedonia widow emperesse wiues mother remained constantinople repining see zeno emperour husband leo neuer accounted worthie empire iordanvs writeth induced brother basiliscvs said ouerthrew gensericvs battaile sea take vpon name emperor reason victorie affinitie late emperor leo mightie highly esteemed able willing make himselfe emperour receiued sware obedience vnto basiliscus made himselfe emperour zeno constantinople constantinople soone zeno vnderstood whether basenesse minde auoide warres effusion blood would haue ensued took care make head retired himselfe isauria strong guardable prouince asia lesse assured himselfe liue securitie whereof basiliscvs waxing proud ioyfull holding himselfe safe past danger made sonne marcvs caesar pride ioy continued marcus made caesar father basiliscus infected nestorian heresie began persecute afflict church catholike christian meanes whereof iordanvs procopivs report grew hatefull abhorred sortes people captaines sent zeno returned himselfe generall consent men basiliscus tyrant dispossessed taken prisoner banished died exile together sonne sister zeno restored reestablished abandoned italy avgvstvlvs remained seeing italy man durst oppose himselfe aduice counsell father made peace entred league gensericvs king vandales africa growne old worne bearing armes euen death dore reason league hee held himselfe great securitie zeno made account seeing discord basiliscvs trouble ruine sprang whence least mistrusted heruli turingi people haue made mention serued warres vnder attila mightie king hunnes time inhabited along riuer danubius furthest consines hungary took captaine man nation called odoacer resolution come italy odoacer king heruli came italy make apart accident way befell odoacer hee beeing approached border italy orestes father avgvstvlvs sallied forth encounter excellent armie father sonne hauing intelligence coming leuied two army comn within sight one general would haue orestes father augustulus march odoacer fought certain company orestes souldiers went ouer vnto odoacer perceiued reposing firm confidence rest remained hee retired best order could towards ticinum called pauia city lumbardy odoacer pursued orestes hauing sufficient armie take field fight suffred besieged city notwithstanding much possible defense yet assault giuen terrible city entred force hee defended many day orestes taken souldiers odoacer souldiers executed extreme cruelty thence orestes carried prisoner placencia odoacer orestes take slain odoacer commandement put death odoacer obtained victory avovstvlvs empire weak foundation lesse equity side thing went prospered enemy small difficulty little resistance odoacer took city italy presently magistrate great dignity authority persia perozas generall king persia whereupon belisarivs set troop order two camp came lodge neer one continued space two three day ranging themselues euery day order battell either partie expecting charge vpon one day certain archer one side beganne skirmish whereupon squadron moued brake one vpon fought manner cruell bloudy battell lasted till neer night wherein roman right battell persian wherein belizarius victory wing worse better left euery captain best obtain victory end roman preuailed made great slaughter enemy perozas mirranes escaped flight together sitta generall encounter came battell one cruellest greatest hapned war battell fought neer riuer euphrates much opinion belisarivs knowing enemie aduantage would haue fought troop prepared themselues whereupon seeing resolution marshald encouraged persian already order fight began great fury obstinacie side greatest part day appeared whether party haue victory vntill time imperialist vnable longer endure toil therof fasting easter euen christian cruell battell age may see inuiolably fasting day obserued time disbanded began scatter whereupon persian horseman charged belizarivs horsetroops force roman brake began flee like squadron foot belizarivs perceiued hee vsed mean stay haue renewed fight could preuail hee alighted horse placed squadron footman kept together whole vnbroken encouraging presence resolued rather dy ouerthrowne ezaretha persian followed chace fled seeing squadron remain whole returned great fury thinking easily haue execution failed purpose kept themselues close together could broken fought valiantly persian harm receiued til night held ground kept themselues order ezaretha men fain leaue ransacking tent returned camp belisarivs good order withdrew little iland riuer euphrates maketh place whither greatest pa souldiers fled already retired next day set order gathered together souldiers persian houlding themselues victorious spoil field journey ezaretha remoued camp another quarter hee receiued greater losse belisarivs insomuch cavadas king persia vnderstanding number men lost battell held himselfe content well serued victory dying shortly sonne cosroes succeeded kingdome many embassy treaty peace concluded cauadas king persia dying son cosroes succeeded belisarivs reconquered country nation held east thus much honoured victorious sent emperor ivstinian warres africa sitta remaining generall came constantinople receiued triumph great solemnity past within fewe day fell great vprore tumult city constantinople likely haue gone ill ivstinianvs tumult great tumult constantinople beginning growing faction common people came point ipativs pompey brother chief men city fauour people took part emperor anastasivs sister sonnes rebelled ivstinian ipativs took ensignes name emperor warre ipatius rebelled constatinople slain iustinian cruell within city thousand person slain end ipativs taken slain ivstinians troop remained victor wherein belisarivs great seruice aboue others afterwards punishing offender confisking good conspiracy trouble appeased ivstinian liued peace better estimation euer soon followed war africa occasion whereof grew dissension gensericvs nephew first king vandal euer raigned africa hapned manner yldericvs one nephewes gensericvs succeeding kingdome beeing contention another cosin germane nephew also gensericvs occasion conquest africa gilimer king thereof whose name gilimer pretended haue title kingdome vpon occasion breuity omit yldericvs grew negligent gilimer wise valiant took prisoner reason made king lord africa vnder title vncapable insufficient gouernment wherewith emperor ivstinian much displeased emperor held friendship yldericvs depriued kingdome whereupon required gilimer ambassadours render kingdome cousin yldericvs refused perform hee resolued make conquest kingdomes africa rigged mighty nauy sent noble generall belisarivs vpon seruice effect commanded great army leuied belisarivs embarking accompanied many belisarius went war africa excellent captain fiue hundred sail ship fourescore twelue gallies hee began voiage towards africa wherein great man born countrey whose name prvdentivs taken arm gilimer city tripoli behalf emperor ivstinian another captain sardinia whose name godas done like belisarivs arriued africa hee found took gilimer kil prisoner power whole force sallie take field belisarivs certain time appointed fight instant would charge areregard hee sent another captain day long trouble one side tire people thereof troop resolutely charged arereguard imperialist began retire manner gilimer made alt procopivs affirms day gotten victory told brother dead caused troop stand belisarivs souldiers vnderstanding good successe auantguard farre animated encouraged returned fight fury gilimer wholly ouerthrowne scattered many people slain hee flight saued life souldiers battel wherein king gilimer ouerthrow escaped battell straggled diuerse part vpon greater execution done night ouertaken next day battell belisarivs marched armie towards city carthage hee arriued euening found resistance opened port made great light haue receiued would night come enemy city leauing vntill next day entred great quietnes without belisarius entred carthage victory spoil murder committed souldiers hauing commanded authority reputation man durst doo contrary vandal carthage withdrew themselues temple church belizarivs granting liues commanded come forth vpon word hee held inuiolably possessing city commanded wals thereof repaired many place decaied occasion gilimer retire thither belisarivs carthage sent poste chief captain called salomon emperor ivstinian giue vnderstand passed gilimer escaped recall brother zazon sardinia whither sent godas wee said arm iland gilimer zazon ouerthrowne slain recouered ile zazon seeing message brother left came zazon brother king gilimer came aid succour force joyn gilimer brother comn hauing recouered sufficient army took way towards carthage besiege belisarivs giue battell would come forth fight belizarivs certain day would take field vntill throughly repaired walles city taken order rest done took field armie drawing neer gilimer attended coming next day one army hauing sight commander set people order fight either side began fury first charge zazon gilimers brother slain certain principall men vandal strook fear among began faint belisarivs charging squadron turned back fled camp well fortified gilimer vnable stay like belizarivs effect hee chose belisarivs general armie came triumphing victorious africa ivstinian time ambassadour italy called peter went thither treat peace amalasvnta theodatvs theodatvs labored come condition peace hee greatly feared power ivstinian whilest hee busie hereabouts belisarivs arriued nauie armie sicilia hee held expedient first take iland suddenly landing men hee presently took citie catania within day marched towards saragossa like fortune entred took like many townes city hee marched palermo found greater force resistance defended selfe certaine day many men slaine side within fearing ruine yeelded themselues belisarivs rest iland belisarius took sicilia expedition good hap warres much hee fame greatly feared theodatvs seeing hapned sicilia standing feare treated ambassadour peter large peter gone message fear much increased theodatvs hee sent vpon way recall ambassador sent peter whose name rvsticvs made swear hee reueal resolution vntill came presence emperor saw whether hee would accept first offer offer whole kingdom italie ivstinian theodatus offered render kingdom italie band iustinian vpon condition giue land possession graecia else liue effect wrote notable letter emperor owne hand ivstinian heard first offer made theodatvs hee valiant prince hautie courage would accept thereof whereupon ambassador discouered second wherein offered italie wherewith hee exceeding glad wrote gratious letter theodatvs therwith sent ambassador confirm agreement command belisarivs making end sicilia passe ouer italie possesse force thereof accord concluded mean time ambassador went came theodatvs captain obtained notable victory slain mvndvs son mavricivs ivstinians captain slauonia defeated imperiall armie reason victory theodatvs grew proud hee onely refused restored greatest part good taken contenting themselues spoile enemy onely sparing citizen protested cause coming set liberty great fear taking naples strake gothes held impregnable wherefore chief men captain amongst gothes discontented theodatus chose vitiges king seeing small prouision theodatvs made assuring belisarivs would continue long naples came rome one inuiting another mette place neer vnto long debating consultation vpon matter chuse wise valiant captain king name called vitiges end presently take order leuying men war defense countrie belisarivs theodatvs vnderstood rome councell opinion theodatus slaine commandement vitiges power sufficient attend belisarivs rome neither sally forth fight field resolued goe rauenna raising sufficient force returne giue battaile
