defend themselues tooke way towards rauenna belisarivs leauing good guard garrison naples marched armie towards rome inhabitant knowing comming resolued would stand vpon defence opened port let agreed together gothes could hinder held best course gone hapned one day one instant belisarivs entred one port sallied another belisarius entred rome made excellent speech senate encouraged embrace libertie presently applied himselfe repaire walles fortifie citie bringing victual prouision part countrie round commandement meane new king vitiges neither idle coward left nothing vndone might encrease power belisarivs first concluded peace king france end bee aduersarie gaue land theodoricvs held france thereby better assured friendship sending ordinarie captaines souldiers vsually held france hee commanded come ioyne germanie part procured aide possibly could finally vsed meanes hee raised rauenna march thereof one hundred fiftie thousand men foote horse good souldiers vitiges leuied armie men foote horse well armed armie began march towards rome wherein belisarivs force might suffice take field fight great enemie whereupon king vitiges nothing doubting victorie grew proud onely tooke care belisarivs flie abandon italie way euer asked whether belisarivs fled reioyced infinitly told fortified himselfe rome seemed meant abide comming valiant belisarivs farre vitiges supposed resolued rather die abandon gotten seeing small power respect aduersarie sent blessvs constantianvs captaines hee sent march presently returne rome troupe hee fortified furnished citie resolution defend stoppe enemie purposed goe forward recouer gotten campania pulia calabria vitiges held way directly towards rome imagining could held arriuall happened great accident although know somewhat detaine yet armie guard bridge one night fear without fight presently gaue vp place night vitiges began passe ouer great part army next morning belisarivs suspecting matter sallied forth rome strange encounter thousand choice horse came towards bridge end chuse fit place lodge people defense stopping passage comn somewhat neer vnto suddenly met vitiges menatarms night past riuer bridge wherewith belisarivs vitiges horseman pursued euen gate rome shut held guard would open fearing letin enemie noise calling knew belisarivs voice accounted dead hauing fought greatest part day driuen lean wall ranging souldiers squadron made head enemie continued fighting without meat sustenance till night valiant though dangerous desperate exploit desperate attempt charged gothes fury beleeued darknes night great troop sallied forth city doubt began retire towards camp belisarivs still charging ariereguard til found free place returned coming port knowne receiued city people although many fewer number sallied euer city rome terribly besieged assaulted gothes continued one whole yeer nine day first seuen moneths time vitiges gothes valiant men neuer ceased batter assault city part receiued much hurt belisarivs people vitiges besiegd rome neuer suffred aduersaries rest neither forbare sallie forth fight field skirmish sally writer affirm slue aboue gothes time maruels arm aswell valour hardinesse wisdome policie excellent captain emperour ivstinian carelesse siege sent reliefe succor men munition belisarivs supplied certaine captain company horse foote corne victualls without great trouble daunger could come rome sufficient endured extreme famine yet notwithstanding managed thing wisely valiantly vitiges seeing rome hardly besieged himselfe armie tired weakned sought make truce concluded three moneths continued long vitiges cunning vitiges took truce belisarius three month treacherie demanded haue leaue come see citie within time truce whereupon warres renewed balisarivs sent commandement captain called iohn marshall armie make cruell warres march rauenna whither sent aboue two thousand horse certaine souldiers time truce imagining harrying quarter vitiges would rise rome captain sped well enterprise took citie arimino place vitiges standing feare vitiges raised siege rome lose rauenna raised siege rome returned defend rest retreit belisarivs charged furiously arierguard slew great number men shame dishonor losse force vitiges returned countrie rauenna resolutely besieged arimino wherein captaine iohn belisarivs auoid losse time leuying force hee could get staied longer whilst went naples fortified city presently took way towards city rauenna warres renewed diuerse part italie belisarivs came captain sent ivstinian called narses eunuch great supply souldiers narses afterwards generall excellent narses sent emperor aid belisarius man already belisarivs relieued iohn besieged arimino losse men constrained vitioes raise siege gallia cisalpina called lombardy milan bergamo nauarra city took part belisarivs whither hee sent captain followed great conflict battels well gothes theodoricvs king france came resolution haue made lord country captain great authority among ydibaldus chosen gothes king italie aft r araricus gothes began growe mighty mean euill gouernment powlings extortion vsed emperor captain country leuying army vntil hee cosroes king persia seeing belisarivs chiefly feared busied cosroes king persia made war empire war italie sought occasion whether fained make warre vpon territory empire entring prouinces took certain imperiall city whereupon ivstinian circumspectly prouided part besides ordinary garrison sent armie east generall thereof valiant gentleman named sitta captain sent persian sitta bucen germanus battell ouerthrowne slain ivstinian sent another called bvcen rare man arm also nephew called germanvs captain souldiers war cruell bloudy cosroes haue time relate imperialist could make sufficient resistance persian cosroes entred far empire leauing mesopotamia persian took many city empire right hand marched towards syria cilicia assault took many good city wherfore ivstinian holding man sufficient war belisarivs sent italie time brought vnder subjection excepting fewe hold castle lombardy wherein gothes fortified themselues belisarivs leauing italie arriuing constantinople within fewe day sent east cosroes mightie king persia comming imperialist took heart reuiued warre discretion courage belisarius sent persian present alteration thing hauing obtained victory certaine cosroes captaines himselfe durst fight recouered much vsurped meanes whereof affaire east went daily well better presence good gouernement belisarivs meane season two yeeres estate italy waxed worse said totila made king gothes followed warres great courage good order hauing ouerthrowne staine emperour ivstinians captaines gothes wanne reputation townes took part excepting held garrison totila marched italy without finding resistance besieged totila good successe italy great citie naples many exploites sea land tooke many others quarter prospered well enterprise seemed short space would without speedie redresse make himselfe lord whole ivstinian perceiued grieuing italy rest commanded belisarivs leauing affaire east best order could make repaire vnto seruant accustomed obey leauing people east comming constantinople without stay sent emperor italy whither went belisarius emperor commandement returned italy great haste could leade aboue fiftie thousand men thought haue found sufficient force made beleeue emperours partie brought great extremitie found quite contrarie much partly seeme comming harme good wished expected friend feared enemy seeing come small force one dismaied took courage beginning enterprise doubtfull tedious putting himselfe rauenna fortifie defend within day took order notwithstanding could keepe field beard enemie mightie yet gothes neuerthelesse rather lose get wherwith totila much displeased desirous make warres vttermost assembled whole power sent captaines company rauenna belisarivs whole armie went rome totila befieged rome slenderly prouided either men munition seemed could long defended belisarivs vnderstanding hereof remembring much trouble extremitie defended citie former time seeing force keepe field neither could put himselfe land much displeased sorrowfull wrote earnest letter emperour ivstinian desiring send men money resoluing put himselfe rome sea rauenna passing ouer dalmatia thence durasso found captaine iohn ivstinian sent good armie wherewith opinion able fight totila reliefe rome held necessarie prouided greater expedition could made armie totila take feared italy would reuolt wheresore resolued goe thither sea put himselfe rome riuer tiber citie called porto mouth tiber held emperour ostia side riuer held gothes captaine iohn crosse sea armie comming calabria march land relieue thus concluded belisarivs sailed arriued porto mouth tiber hauing sufficient power march land reason totila great armie hee speedily rigged great number barkes fregates fraughted men belisarius passed vp riuer tiber determination relieue rome munition passed vp riuer notwithstanding totila narrowest place riuer drawne chaines made bridge two castle end bridge guarded great number souldiers meanes stop passage yet belisarivs followed course vp riuer comming bridge people sort charged guarded brake scattered passed rome presently relieued euery thing good successe befallen strange mishap troubled altered belizarivs left wife familie wife loued much warres euer carried port named entrie riuer garison held fort good captaine whose name isaaz expresse commandement sallie forth without walles keepe fortresse isaaz hearing newes belisarivs victorie desirous doe notable exploit himselfe sallied towne garrison charge totila souldiers lay although first disordered made retire yet end ouerthrowne taken prisoner whereof belisarivs presently aduertised sled report went without author towne taken wife enemy great misfortune besell belisarius hand vnderstood grieued enraged without expecting furthernewes returned downe riuer determination either die set wife libertie imagining sped well might speedily returne rescue rome come port found place deuotion wife well libertie although captaine lost whereupon tooke greater displeasure see himselfe thus deluded first euill newes night arriuall port extreme choler griefe taken vnknowne occasion extremely taken feuer fell downe dead disease daily encreasing oftentimes point death meane time space many day totila straightly besiege citie within died hunger eate dog cat rat thing seemed impossible totila tooke rome totila end hauing citie power sent ambassadours ivstinian offering seruant good friend preserue keepe citie hee would grant peace would raze make cruell warre could ivstinian answered generall belsarivs italie referred matter totila enraged answere hee resolued ruine rome hee hee made capitoll selfe bee burned best part citie third part walles hee caused throwne downe commanded inhabitant abandon citie vpon paine death goe liue place totila burn destroyed rome left burned desolate waste citie commanded world beene greatest frequented best peopled others marched iohn armie sent ivstinian came calabria towards rome shewed himselfe coward hee durst attend field put himselfe otranto furthest place calabria totila without resistance tooke calabria abruzzo lucania vntill held emperour ivstinian meane time belizarivs recouered health performed one belisarius entred rome end fortifie defend desperate attempt euer done time troupe goe put himselfe rome resolution repaire reedefie defend first sending wife constantinople presently went rome desolate lay caused expedition trench digged rampiers made walles throwne downe victual possibly could gotten brought thither made citie lay waste fame hereof many citizen could get loue countrie came put themselues thereinto whereof soone totila aduertised long iourneys without intermission returned againe assuring himselfe presently enter take belisarivs belisarivs valiantly defended great losse totila driuen raise siege whereby may imagined totila besieged rome therin belisarius well would haue defended ruinated repaired new port rampiers meane season captaine iohn calabria pulia gathered citizen rome together sent thither whose citie belisarivs remained hauing fortified left good garrison therein excellent gouernour called conon went ioyne iohn captaines pursue totila many thing hapned long recited king persia againe making war east ivstinian resolued send belisarivs thither although afterwards belisarius sent italy went peace concluded betweene vpon occasion belisarivs againe went italie although great good fortune victory first yet disgrace neither lesse honor neuer failed thing doe behoued able summe went constantinople remai ed remainder life liued certaine yeeres agathivs writeth hun came thracia euen neer constantinople robbing spoiling countrie belisarivs old sent ouerthrew battaile ivstinian sent returne hee wholly ruined within day belisarivs departed italy totila returned rome againe besieged long siege great extremity famine endured totila besieged took rome besieged negligence iohn haue relieued treason others fierce barbarian tooke taking time quite contrarie last harme sought repaire repeople gaue great gift priuiledges exemption inhabitant end returne dwell afterwards took many place passed ouer sicilia could easily make conquest thereof left foure captaines many men warre therein returned italy narses captaine ivstinian sent come thither within short space made himselfe absolute lord whole countrie narses famous captain valiant great experience priuate emperor ivstinian therefore rich great authoritie came narses came generall italy totila italy great armie leuied sundrie nation hunnes heruli warlike people amongst came seruice people called longobardi dwelt hungarie marched land along coast adriaticque sea called gulfe venice vntill came rauenna notwithstanding entrie italy encounter conflict totila captaines came ioyne captaines company belisarivs left staying day rauenna tooke field armie directing course rome totila way coward attended comming vpon way battaile betweene narses totila wherein totila slaine presenting battaile fought fight totila slaine people scattered ouerthrowne victorie occasion narses easily reconquered italy fight held iourney besieged rome notwithstanding gothes totila left garrison defend well yet narses took assault great losse defendant departing thence took al town city round death totila gothes made great man amongst whose name teyas king took totila treasure lay pauia sought teyas made king gothes get men aide narses sent intreate reliefe french would intermeddle warre teyas seeing narses tooke city town without finding man fight departed lombardie power hee could make marched towards campania narses staied lodged army vpon riuer side notable skirmish came battaile mo cruell battaile wherein teyas slaine one cruell fought warre historian report wonder wrought teyas king gothes owne person end ouerborne narses men slaine iust twelue clocke noone time fought six howers yet notwithstanding death battaile ceased vntill darke night parted without apparance victorie either side reposing themselues well could night next morning gothes despaire imperialist despited see people without captaine defend themselues returned againe fight without ceassing gothes taking benefit side hill defended themselues end towards night sent ambassador vnto narses offering render held italy conditionally giue leaue liue without armour weapon request narses graunted would fight desperate people great losse armie already receiued deliuered possessed continued italie subiect inhabitant manner within short space name gothes wholly extinct rooted forgotten although presently victory captain company remained gallia cisalpina called lombardy prouince traspadana piemont began fortifie crauing traspadana piemons aide succour comming france burgundy war renued lasted welneere one whole yeere therein passed great battailes end narses obtained field victorie absolute commander italie pleased god make instrument yeeres time warre iustin died gowte hee raigned eleuen yeeres hard matter abbreuiate relate accident happened time emperour ivstinian much troubled therewith many notable doe onely feele selfe eased daughter son ivstin second without difficultie obtained empire haue iustin obeyed emperor said grandfather life time made companion proclaimed successor mother said ivstinians daughter father great valiant expert man warre generall thereof reason last ouerthrowe hee made law king persia neuer present battell hee renewed warre empire recouer lost honour emperor sent new generall valiant wise side slain victorie shewed self mavrice side recouered certain battel wherein maurice victory place conquered others persian hormisda constrained necessity conclude peace truce emperor mavrice came held empire thing hapned according desire took many city state italy longobards desirous repose sent captain company towards rome took city march thereof rome self besieged great danger haue entred force author affirm clephis liued little longer made lord rome rauenna two eye fortress italy designes made frustrate death like king captain haue great greater euer hee whose death practised treason ovvne people decease lombard would neither chuse haue king time arose thirty principall thirty tyrant lombard men speak properly thirty tyrant inuested themselues thirty best town held italie euery gouerned town territorie thereof likewise made war apart sometimes one aiding assisting empire emperor tiberivs busied making prouision war persian sufficiently prouide italy captain lombard oportunity extend power took many city coming rome naples warre committed cruelty robbery insolencies like neuer seen rome eastward remained little subject empire kingdom naples city rome town march thereof city naples fell also hand lombard cannot certainly say whether time afterwards yet rauenna held empire strong houlds neer vnto wisdome foresight longinvs defended also held empire either side riuer po como cremona mantoa padoa bologna vercelli lombard time rest thus warre managed either side great cruelty lombard barbarous yet well receiued faith christ robd spoild aswell sacred profane souldiers new tyrant brought back constantinople hauing first seene death wife child hand executioner head striken endured great resolution raigned twentie yeeres mavricivs peaceably obtained empire king persia romane emperor mavricivs sent armie generall worthie nobleman called philippicvs hee married sister whome k hormisda raised philippicus generall persian greater force made great man called cardariga generall som notable skirmish encounter philippicvs came maine battaile power power lasted aboue tenne houres one charging manner aduantage could seene end philippicvs troupe victorie battaile wherein philippicus victorie slew great number persian took two thousand prisoner hee sent emperour constantinople rest escaped flight generall cardariga philippicvs hauing obtained notable victorie marched forward armie sent good commander called heraclivs selected troupe direction enter farre might persian countrie promising second notwithstanding cardariga ouerthrowne yet discouraged neither omitted vse meanes diligence good generall belong gathering together force could making shew hee would reinforce armie small troupe hee passing ouer certaine mountaines darke night set vpon philippicvs arierguard feare great philippicvs though victorious shamefully fled whole night shamefull flight philippicus long smalle losse slaughter people much persian imagining flight haue beene fained seeing dared follow chace rested vntill day light freed one feare shewed aduantage lost heraclivs philippicvs sent followed direction better discretion greater diligence passing ouer riuer tigris fame late victorie took city much hurt returned towards philippicvs rich prey spoiles victorie past romane armie gathered againe together emperor commanded philippicvs leauing armie heraclivs make repaire constantinople philippicvs obeyed commandement place sent valiant expert captaine called priscvs come armie shewed himselfe proud haughtie captaines men warre mutined priscus made generall persian place philippicus generally ill intreated men driuen saue himselfe flight hauing receiued blowes knockes stone daunger haue slaine amongst themselues chose germanvs general man great account armie time mavricivs oppressed warres cayanvs auares slauons slauonia missia prouinces whereof speake hereafter could punish great insolencie therefore soone vnderstood thereof held expedient send backe philippicvs gouernor generall priscvs returne besides philippicvs hee also sent another nobleman great estimation called aristobvlvs pacifie mutinie rebellion armie entreaty philippicus restored charge gift otherwise best manner could performed philippicvs againe vndertook charge returned warre marvzas new generall persian greater armie named came argument great wealth power king persia often ouerthrowne still returned great force alwaies desired peace empire willingly graunted end emperor well contented defend confines held matter great consequence two great captaines army came neere together party desired giue battaile wherein fought obstinately one cruell battailes world one partie fought obstinacie courage lasted greatest part day persian ouerthrowne eyther discouraged ranne away almost slaine annales constantinople finde written three thousand taken prisoner two thousand escaped flight rest died fighting generall marvzas campe left romanes found man therein make resistance spent one whole yeere frontier warres end whereof king hormisda commanded great army leuied philippicvs presuming former victory made doubt giue battaile persian refused fought neere citie marticopolis therin philippicvs romanes ouerthrowne great losse confusion emperor sorrie prouided new generall east sent philippicvs come constantinople direction leaue armie heraclivs made late mention till another general com performed afterwards romanvs sent king persia sent another whose name baras two general arriued new charge either sought winne honour diuers incounters lost many men burned townes greatest harme euery could vntill last drew neere fought ranged battaile wherein baras persian ouerthrowne field albania asia great prouince east bordering vpon armenia hormisda grieued losse imagining happened defect generall thereby disgrace sent woman garment commaunded presently leaue gouernement yet notwithstanding set matter good order gathered together scattered armie seate battaile betweene roman persian successe empire graecia yet emperor euer tooke glory bee called romane emperours army romane army imperialist holding themselues disgraced dishonest great desire bee reuenged presence great valor emperor great helpe thereto one fought great courage obstinacie battaile continued long cruell although beginning doubtfull yet end emperour obtained victorie made name mavias sent intreate emperor peace offering profitable honourable condition thereby bound himselfe pay yeerely mauias king sarazins sought emperor constantine peace emperor great number pound markes golde present release many thousand prisoner held captiues whereupon peace graunted confirmed consantine ease himselfe trouble might apply himselfe reformation matter concerning christian faith hee concerning hee ought beleeue good christian concluded tenth yeere raigne presently ensued another trouble warre equall former certaine people prouinces scithia fountaine many others mentioned bulgaria space prouince lower misia assigned vnto name called bulgaria wherein haue quietly peaceably inhabited vntill late yeeres subdued conquered turkes new scourge plague christian mahomet thing passed sicilia graecia asia space tenne yeeres italy although peace betweene lombard italian yet wonderfull alteration element italy failed misery persecution happened great many tempest alteration air seemed foure element conspired mankinde windes furious violent ouerthrew many building rent vp many tree rootes raine likewise great tempestuous destroyed tillage well breadcorne kind hearbs seedes therewith fell infinite number thunderbolt fire heauen slew great number people earth great alteration became corrupt ensued many contagious disease wherfore people repenting sinnes made prayer supplication god would please cease great calamity yet reliques thereof remained long time time died pope deodatvs reason death seate voide foure moneths making new election rome donvs onely called chosen pope held saint liued two yeeres halfe saith platina time theodore archbishop rauenna wholly submitted himselfe church rome whereas predecessor fauor exarch gouernors denied others amongst blondvs affirme hapned time successor agathvs wholiued two yeers half time although short treated councell held constantinople emperor concerning general councel held principally heresy monothelites dispersed ouer church graecia confounded two nature christ humane diuine affirming time greeke church remained vnited latine pleased god afterwards suffer come wee see power subiection insidels councell many matter handled concerning reformation church ceremony thereof sixt councels vvhich excellency renowned famous among rest called vniuersall great reputation emperour constantine purchased haue celebrated councell time haue finished holy worke within dayes pope aoathvs dyed whose authority called leo second borne sicilie succeeded worthily aduanced learned eloquent holy life ordained paxe giuen church obserued church rome vntill day dead benedict second succeeded whose election emperour well pleased confirmed renounced right custome emperor held confirme election pope end thenceforth soone clergy chosen might vse authority without need emperor confirmation exarch gouernours long time vsed constantine liuing prosperity peace sarazins prouinces africa ile sicilia quiet italie lombard variance dissension among themselues firmely maintained peace empire estate graecia territorie constantinople quiet subiection good forme manner gouernment disturbed emperours death shortly ensued hee raigned seuenteene yeeres protected defended empire inherited iustice equity reforming errours christian religion aforesayd thus falling grieuously sicke constantinople much diminished decaid city constantinople freed deliuered siege also fewe escaped liues three thousand saile brought thither beginning fewe returned people seems matter incredible besides cast away perpetually banished put away wife noble woman called mary diuorcing shut vp nunnerie maried one maid called theodora enamoured woman desert onely fair beautifull time constantine mother raigned east charles great king france called great exploit performed yet charles great called opinion called reason great constitution body corpulent big limd tall liued ease vndergon great dangerous war beginning emperor constantine raign king charles came person italy see pope pacifie certain combustion raised duke desirous innouations quieted hee intelligence duke bauiere called king rebelled intent exempt subjection end leuied force whereupon charles resolued go person another way send sonne pepin vpon seruice beganne make cruell warre whereof eastern emperor constantine aduertised imagining charles beeing busied warres would able prouide affair italy hee sent commandement country held som new troop leuied purpose make warre pope king charles presently put execution duke beneuent spoleto city made speedy preparation easily repelled ouerthrowne thenceforth liued quiet peace charles likewise good success war bauarians although without effusion much bloud hee pacified state reduced prouinces seruice thence hee went slauons held prouinces istria dalmatia called slauonia one summer brought vnder dominion afterwards raising new power resolued make conquest hungary austria beeing antient pannoniae hunnes auares long time possessed said notwithstanding dangerous warre therein many great notable battels wherein nobility greatest part common people country died land lay manner waste dispeopled yet end eightth yeer beginning thereof became absolute lord countrey charles great conquerd hungary austria charles ward king denmark subdued saxon foresaid warres warres king denmark dane harried seacoast fleet heerin well rest glorious prince victory afterwards made peace king resolued make end subduing sexons whose warres time rebelled continued thirty yeers slue one battell thirty thousand another fought afterwards brought wholly obedience made subject empire better security led principal france conquest briefly haue recited battels fought person son europe new emperor michael took many city graecia besieged city constantinople wherein emperor put shift hardly escaped either taken slain thus distressed despair resolued try last perilous remedy treated hee ouerthrowne peace gaue king wife kinswoman duke daughter assigned part france lieth beyond riuer sein bordering vpon english sea day called normandy good countrey coming norman int normandy well inhabited yet historian say emperor charles charles simple afterwards hee came bee king france time infant vnder gouernment evdon opinion long time afterwards warres howsoeuer emperor charles fat lord greatest best part france called king thereof time king germany emperor italy setting thing good order retired germanie arriued state dominion empire grounded vpon weak foundation suddenly fell height throne alledge cause thereof became foolish proud vnfit gouern others say disease took bereaued sens cometh one effect conclude prince duke gouerners prouinces germany france seeing great insufficiency vnaptnes gouern resolued depriue empire charls fat deposed empire arnolph chosen place kingdomes much neuer sonne write vnapt nature generation common consent nominated chose great valiant personage called arnolph charles aduanced duchy bauaria carinthia write mean parentage way allied charles account charles fat last linage bloud charles great common opinion arnolph besides happened report time arnold duke bauiere said feare conrade liued exile hungary returned countrie gathering together great number hungars hardy call himselfe emperour deny obedience emperour henry vnderstanding leuying old subject saxony others empire went mighty army arnold likewise marched towards good christian much grieued tronbles likely haue ensued forbare procure arnold giue ouer attempt pleased god good desire tooke effect manner army readinesse fight notwithstanding apparant emperour greater number better choise men yet sent arnold word trumpet vpon sufficient securitie come speake arnold performed emperor among many graue good discreete speech spake vnto word take heede arnold consider thou doest oppose thy selfe speech vsed henry arnold god ordinance giuer kingdomes worldly power thou maist know chosen mouth predecessor conrade death election haue consented estate germany thou onely seekest resist god generall consent men say vnto thee take heede thou doest aduise thee come obedience vse thee sonne brother thou wilt doe take god iudge betweene thee one thing sweare assure thee pleased diuine maiestie thou haddest chosen emperor would haue obedient subiect haue serued thee faithfully wherefore pray thee sith thou wilt like mee thou mayest see intreat thee peace time party hath aduantage warres consider well thou doest faile thing haue promised like speech force much moued arnold presently submitted himselfe countrey vnto emperor henry thenceforth euer obedient vnto arnold submitted himselfe henry without remembrance matter past happened likewise discord betweene henry house kingdome france soueraignty prouince duchie lorraine neuerthelesse comming peace agreement matter passed prosperously continued lord thereof germany meanes good gouernment took taste fruites iustice tranquillity peace bring forth italy notwithstanding berengarivs called emperor want prince henry wrought contrary shall amisse therefore speake followed henry infidel remained pulia leuying new force supply renewed warres foreseene time reason domesticall discord took many castle city pope applied himselfe reuenged albericvs power much encreased people voluntarily yeelded themselues reason small reliefe emperor constantinople whose dominion greatest part country berengarivs pope vntil feare seised rome wherein making taine earle called gvido general amongst author berengarii tyrant rodulph duke burgundy emperour italie emperor one name rodvlph remaining victory italy called emperor held empire space three yeers prosperity time emperor henry germany ouerthrew repelled hungars departure italy went germany wherein much harme say emperour put rout chased thence taking generall prisoner constrained sue make peace ten yeres hee restoring generall comming hungars italie without ransom yet offred great summe mony rodvlphvs hauing faigned three yeeres italy hungars whose ordinary qualitie spoile neighbour prouinces solicited therto time warre thus happily ended another followed dane mightie nauie came friseland saxonie tooke certaine townes made flie countrie great losse hee also ouerthrew norway called abroditi henry hauing obtained great many victory time peace hungars expired presently sent ambassador require certain pay granted ancestor time peace made whereto henry gaue good answere accounted matter vnworthy majestie constantinople otho sonne otho therefore called second yet truth third soon father dead well father worthinesse life time elect crowned rome pope wee haue otho according order roman emperor second third roman emperor name related without contradiction receiued obeyed emperor otho man great spirit valiant shewed action though later end raign hee vnfortunate shall vnderstand hee beginning rule empire christian prince sent ambassador vnto condole death father congratulate succession prince germany came homage onely henry duke bauiere cosin germane sonne henry brother father otho haue made mention father made duke bauaria man great power therewith proud refused yeeld obedience new emperor otho raised army went compelled submit yeeld obedience befell first yeer raign thence hee marched town slauonia took arm mean time prouince lorrain combustion procured lotharivs king france vpon newes whereof otho returned germany french king raised force suddenly entred lorrain made lord thereof pretending prouince appertain crown france content haue subdued country within fewe day marched forward spoiling wasting country euen aken otho small force nothing mistrusting king france would haue proceeded farre warre like haue taken driuen depart thence haste french king retiring great prey spoil emperor much displeased doings raised mighty army next yeer following great courage equall power entred kingdome france manner french king neither durst able fight retired fortified city paris whither otho came king therein spoiled country reuenge harm receiued coming within sight city lost people skirmish french seeing king salied forth giue battell could besiege aduantage resolued winter return country retreit king france sent duke burgundy prince charge arieregard gagvin french historian write passage ouer riuer growne high reason raine could waded receiued great harme enemy slew great part armie germanes doe brauely describe yet acknowledge haue lost som people passage emperor returned resolued haue prosecuted warre hapned otherwise gaue eare treatie peace betweene french king moued certaine prelate concluded shew whereof warres italie made greeke emperor chief damasco besieged christian many dangerous skirmish wherefore aduice counsel certaine men countrie corrupted mony besieged desired deceiue prince remoued campe side abandoned fit place siege whereof ensued infidel taking aduantage hill fortified greatly annoy hill situate stopt comming victual campe besieged defended themselues valiantly famine much encreased prince army imposs liue remained displeased treason meanes punishment righting wrong began many men opinion reputed good emperour great iusticer yet amongst men better sort blamed oppression vsed sueuia place beginning hee without contradiction obeyed men day moneth march yeere hee summoned generall parliament diet held citie haguena principall point handled get aide reliefe prince estate empire towards iourney italy crowned rome concluded doe many offered seruice accompanie iourney go leuied force put themselues readiness expedition beginning iuly following met citie augsburgh whence took way towards italy first leauing wife empresse saxony citie branschaiel inheritance townes held defended part estate henry proud deposed descending downe valley trent went directly verona receiued obeyed councell held emperor bologna lord thence went milan city lombardy bologna whither summoned city lombardy townes city subiect empire italy come councel wherein fortunate obeyed came summons peaceably furnished men mony iourney many earles baron accompanied person sort departed thence strong towards rome pope innocent attended comming noble came receiued great ioy himselfe crowned peter church pope much desired see day perswading haue great friend seeing euer procured greatnes emperor philip emperor accustomed manner sware obedience church rome enlarge vsurpe patrimonie thereof afterwards hardly performed day betweene souldiers remained camp neere walles rome part whereof come see citie citizen arose great tumult bickering abou thousand emperours men slaine wherewith hee much incensed pope indeede friend seeing greater inconueniences likely haue ensued departed came directly milan army accusing blaming pope passed milan hee receiued obeyed lay winter tempestuous leauing imperiall ensignes wherewith milanois held themselues greatly honoured reinforcing army discharged great part thereof departed spring make conquest church land first prouince tuscane took many place thence went marca de ancona like could resisted thence thought would haue made warre territorie rome haue besieged emperor made warres pope citie pope sent legate vnto putting mind fauours good office done require admonish others quarter wherewith pope lesse displeased former rather held kingdomes feodatorie church rome also pope protection gouernment young king pope seeing ambassages admonition preuailed resolued vse violent course proceeding censure excommunication letter messenger excommunicated italy germany also excommunicated followed seruice excommunication prelate obeyed wheruepon new trouble began emperour grandfather frederice staied fight battell emperor milanois field met neer place called cro ona marched great desire fight fought cruell battell army number force manner equall fought many houres battell city rebelled compounded yeelded obedience pope aduertised calamity milanois league whose cause seemed protect defend fearing emperor greatnes knew hate made league venecians knew bee much grieued pitifull death duke sonne resolued succour milan confederate better bring passe made kinde peace truce ten yeers city venice genoa time warres vsed mean receiued rome hauing euer since last trouble liued rome hee sent buls emperor published christendome excommunicated took part cremona refreshed army battell came pauia leauing milan make warre vpon venecians aduertised pope fulmination authority predecessor men began stand fear afterwards ensued matter passed germany great moment tell passed italy touching papacy manner end two yeeres three month death pope nicholas fourth time successor perugia whither cardinal repayred make election chosen zealous man monke hermite called peter mvrron thinking himselfe haue bin called god accepted popedom named celestine fift beginning whole power make head gvnther force armes defeate resolution emperor charles army took way towards mentz one drawing neere war began men thought would haue proued terrible cruell death gvnther peace ensued time write concluded soone gvnther fell sick vnpassionate prince sought reconcile condition peace gvnther renounce empire charles charls giue two walled city turinge together confines time treaty writer affirme gvnther died poysoned physician giue purging potion taking assay died together gvnther next morrow made men thinke without knowledge poore physician poyson put decoction gvnther dying time parle peace charls remained sole emperour good sort compounded aduersaries weary choosing emperor controuersy ended contentment men much plague aken great solemnity crowued another city going afterwards progresse visited many city gaue sundry priuileges time prosperity sonne whose name wenceslavs shall haue cause speake hereafter applying great care maintain peace justice yet rested goe crowned italy whereof pope clement sixt desirous time could died within day time viscount hauing made themseluss lord milan great power many city chiefest iohn viscount archbishop milan man feared pope without suspicion might come fell sick died tenth yeer raign emperor wenceslavs manner said depriued robert duke bauiere count palatine chosen place hee man quick apprehension little stature great spirit careful studious maiesty empire publique affair famous integrity iustice well practised arm coming aix crowned would receiue city pretending yet bound oath wenceslavs wherefore new remisse behauiour little worth wenceslavs morgages sale made father charls giuen liberty exemption territory empire empire scarcely retained authority reputation imperiall country prince germany ought haue giuen robert wise prudent prince mighty great power tenne yeers raigned made great reformation matter settled best order possible aswell controuersies warres germany execution iustice good great estate many city thought haue king yea emperour lord italie time made cruell warre florentine durst able make head assisted sonnes barnaby tyrant milan sonnes beene tyrannes gouernours padoa hee deposed others hee wronged dispossessed many others stand feare bee dealt withall like manner matter standing tearmes election coronation emperor robert published florentine sent ambassador entreate perswade seeing emperour bound thereto come italie free countrey cruell pernicious tyrant duke iohn milan vsurped many townes empire church therewith offered giue towards charge summe two hundred thousand florines whereof one hundred thousand presently hand rest first day enter tyrant duke countrey army wherein would assist greatest power able make foote horse ambassador arriued germany well entertained emperor presently accepting offer seruice promised come italie aswel enterprise milan crowned rome therupon presently began prouide thing necessary iourney duke milan hauing intelligence florentine came army within sight brescia held duke milan duke city march thereof many good men warre make head feared offer battaile duke cauallerie excellent good horseman skirmish encounter wheresoeuer met aduantage germanes slew many one day comming ioyne whole force battaile emperour army ouerthrown neere lake benaco called garda thus broken hee retired emperor robert ouerthrown italy duke milan trent stood great doubt perplexity thinke whither returne germany reinforce army returne italie duke austria archbishop colein leauing returned home wherewith emperor grieued ready haue done like perswaded francis carrara sonne carrara tyrant padoa italian captaines thinking shame returne without tryall fortune went army reinforced farre triuigi thence padoa meanes carrara receiued detaine wherefore two ambassadours returned post florence conferre citizen matter two remained emperour winter fit time make warre hauing great desire see citie went venice sumptuously entertained vnderstanding ancestor philip died thirteenth day august yeer lord two fiftith age two thirtith raign died left neuer son one base daughter called blanch said maried francis sforc duke dead city milan cry liberty empire made choice twelue men gouern sudden alteration many sought haue lord therof milanois said desired liberty king alonso naples arragon title duchie milan pretended title inheritance duke philip testament made heir dominion emperor better right pretended estate appertain empire default heir therefore return empire hee time come italy reason great fear danger coming turk hungary emperor tutor young king hee defend francis sforc hauing married base daughter duke philip pretended title duchie milan right wife charles duke orleans would haue hee sonne valentina sister duke philip father valentina married levves duke orleans brother charles sixt king france wherefore charles pretended duchy appertain vnto venecians taking right occasion offred presently seised sundry town hand cremona placencia lodi pretended title duchy milau sent ambassador milanois absolutely make claim thereunto certain complement offer assist venecians took townes milanois would accept soueraign emperor intreated permit enioy liberty vpon condition whereof would yeerly giue cup gold token vassallage subiection effect dis atched ambassador vnto god secret iudgement reserued estate francis sforc hapned manner francis sforce certified death father law philip venecians made themselues lord countrie hasted cremona owne towne giuen wiues dowrie fortifying garrisoning furnishing caesar made peace gladly accepted agreement bound themselues assist certain troupe men warre resoluing put execution intended make himselfe lord milan bent force townes city lombardy tooke force faire meanes end besieged city milan itselfe many accident receiued title right armes called duke milan afterwards coming lord whole estate mighty valiant prince liued many yeers lord thereof time matter passed milan italy emperor fr derick dissolution councell basil sought mean root schism betwixt pope felix still called pope obeyed sauoisns emperor counsell authority much preuailed forced come obedience renouncing papacy pope nicholas made cardinall legate sauoy certaine prouinces shortly ensued great warres germany many imperiall city marquesse bra denburgh assisted earle wittembergh warre space two yeers lasted fought nine seuerall time fortune fauoring sometime one sometime much harme done emperour could pacifie vntill length intercession commandement peace concluded prince city hauing settled concord resolued come italy great desire hee crowned wherein alonso king naples arragon allie great friend venecians also friend loued peace euer sought maintaine hauing resolued goe iourney agreed marry lady elenor daughter king portugall decreed shee come italie sea nuptials solemnized whereupon leuied indifferent army foote horse prouided thing necessary iourney departing conquest thereof emperor disliking ambition prince temporizing best manner hee could answered generall tearmes without concluding thing night without bidding farewell departed city wherewith duke much meaning could take colen required raise siege taking effect leuied great army therewith marched directly duke slack businesse needed considering duke power haue speedily brought great army came expedition cause required besieged countrey thereabout endured great extremity siege continued many moneths comming length though late first one army encamping neere emperor came duke saxony marquesse brandenburgh archbishoppes mentz treuiere point haue giuen battaile thought would haue cruell treaty peace propounded betweene whereto emperour neuer refused giue eare much hee therefore called argvment frederick dead sonne maximilian father life time gouernment empire without contradiction made emperor beginning raign hee disposing go warres turke kept great stirre hungary made flee hee took wife blanch daughter duke milan made great warres swissers emperor time pisans germany made insurrection one greatest tumult seen soon suppressed subdued many rebel beganne growe cause dissension spain france duchie milan emperor made warre uenecians followed terrible battailes rauenna marinian diuers accident warre ended fained yet time durable peace emperour maximilian departed life raigned yeeres peaceable frederick followed son warlike victorious maximilian father life time crowned king romanes yeere father emperour frederick died turkes made incursion countrie croacia prouince hungary bordereth vpon dalmatia new emperour desiring preuent danger speedily raising force went fight hauing intelligence comming retired whereupon dissolued army emperour maximilian hauing bin good space widower father dead contracted lady blanch daughter galea niece levves sforce duke milan vncle gouernor nephew iohn galea right duke vsurped held estate blanch fairest woman time wooed many prince yet duke milan aid emperor swissers coming battell neer nouarra father taken prisoner obtained victory death ouerthrowe imprisonment many driuing french duchy remained lord thereof peace presently yeere emperor resoluing let french king know committed error keeping peace made concluded came composition henry eight king england enemie french king enter france make warre performance condition king england came cali entring france emperour army came ioyned although french king durst fight battaile yet passed many notable skirmish betweene notwithstanding king england lay two moneths terrouenne yet french king space daring come free towne constrained yeelde king taking place went tournay battered fury yeelded together castle townes neere adiacent whereof king england lord made great spoyle countrey without finding army field make head emperour like manner another way sent vdal ick duke wittembergh great troupe swissers burgundy besieging dijon hauing brought distresse thought prouince would haue lost swissers according accustomed manner consideration one hundred thousand ducat sent french king moued hope promised greater summe raising siege returned home house maugre duke wittembergh generall people seeing himselfe abandoned returned also countrey lkewise happened whilest king england made warre france king scot instigation french king entred england person came katherine queene england accompanied nobility common realme fighting scot notwithstanding victory doubtful vnequall reason great multitude yet king slaine battaile scot daring longer hold field returned home english entring scotland took certaine place sort king england wiues meanes england emperor ayde france returned victorious countrey emperour presence requisit germany like wormes much debate contention betweene estate ecclesiastical secular also great controuersie william levves duke bauiere emperor nephewes son brother inlaw albert whereupon emperour went sort mitigating contention brought peace yeere venecians made league french king effected meanes bartelmevv dalviano generall taken prisoner king andrevv gritti venecian gentleman afterwards one excellent duke hath venice likewise prisoner peace concluded betweene england france french king took wife mary king england sister liued mariage falling extremely sick died vpon first day ianuary yeere lord raigne succeeded often named francis duke angulesme coronation procured league made emperour whereupon earle nassaw came paris new mariage concluded charles prince spaine renata sister clavdia new queene france marriage afterwards took effect emperour consented liked well march well reason trouble germany peace common good expected ensue thereof better preseruation particular peace made ladislavs king hungary bohemia resolued marry niece mary levves eldest son said king notwithstanding young whereupon iuly yeare meeting appointed held viena austria whither came sigismvnd king poland ladislavs king hungary bohemia sonne levves emperour duke bauiere many prince germany said levves prince hungary betrothed marie emperor niece also agreed ferdinand castile marrie sister anne afterwards took effect raigned kingdomes decease brother inlaw levves marriage accomplished emperor decease yeer french king francis knowing emperor enclined peace feasting banquetting hauing little confirmed peace england venecians also done like emperor within short space leuied great army german lantzknechts resolution inuade duchie milan army past alp neere turin ioyned vncle charles duke sauoy comming verselli thither came souldiers sent genoais request octavian fregoso duke thence went nouarra yeelded without assault passing towards milan knowing duke army swissers sent emperor intended giue battaile sought haue corrupted swissers money king levves took said duke father failing thereof discouered enemy fought betweene milan marinian neere village called saint brigets battaile fiercely fought signe victory ouertaken night darke battaile marinian moone left fighting neither party knew retire stood night armed expecting day come renewed battaile time rumor spred ouer camp bartholomevv dalviano hand venecian army marched night come joyne french king whereupon swissers fearing great succor fled victory remaining french king cruell slaughter made poore swissers gvichardine writes swissers grew proud first day fight bruited throughout italie put enemy army flight king carefull prouide thing fit safety breake day swissers despised french army force italie vnited returned charge like fury rashnesse french entertained great valour discretion withall alviano commander venecian force comming lighthorsemen charged swissers back despaired victory sounding retraite retyring good order towards milan great astonishment french men durst follow one furious battailes euer seene italie king hauing obtained notable victory duke maximilian abandoning citie milan withdrew castle whereupon city yeelded king city like duke besieged assaulted castell notwithstanding emperour certified would speedily send releefe compounding french king certaine summe money king promised giue yearely resigned title state milan putting king power went france afterwards dyed french king hereupon receiued french king possession du hie milan milan city without resistance wherewith emperour much displeased made preparation comming italy whereof king standing doubt sought enter league pope leo seeing victorious glad match appointing meete bologna league confirmed ended king returning france left duke bourbon army state milan time vpon fiue twentith day ianuary yeare dyed king ferdinand madril neere guadalupe spaine gouernment kingdomes called charles afterwards emperor sixteene yeeres old went thither yeere following duchy milan conquered french king manner said within dayes emperor maximilian way verona came italy florishing army would haue bin glad haue met french king duke bourbon lombardy daring keepe field shut vp himselfe milan emperour finding resistance held way vntill hee came citie besieged together rest soone recouered could haue staied country treasure reuenues ferdinand cardinall memory queen isabel suffer indignity done take worthy personage attended faithfully see ignominiously disgraced cardinall sought milde word pacifie incensed courage prince laying king brother pleasure tended aduancement would shew obedient tractable told loued deerely wrong confessed care good seruants honorable must withall know king brother dearer vnto therfore exhorted giue aide ferdinand emperor therein exhibiting sundry complaint ferdinand ferdinand pretending kingdome hungary right marching forward army without resistance took buda principall place kingdom vnwilling giue enemy time recouer heart courage ferdinand entring hungary army iohn sepusius taketh buda without great difficulty passing riuer tissa vpon bridge made boates brought thither purpose vpon cart went seeke toccay within sight castle making alt made valene tvrac generall army day battaile diuided cauallery stiria austria two squadron middest betweene raunged maine battaillion one army hungarian footemen order ference bodo generall king battaile toccay fought betweene iohn ferdinand pretending king nungary iohns army perceiued marshalling troupe like manner perswaded king iohn certaine troupe choise horse withdraw himselfe place army might notwithstanding sinister accident saue himselfe whose example phvl barchit seruian one chiefest captaines king ferdinand army retired himselfe close place good distance army determination charge enemy flanke briefe two army ioyned battaile wherein space fight doubtfull left wing king iohns battaile charging right stirian horse gallantly ouerbearing put king ferdinand people rout men armes austria rescuing furie charged enemy constrained retire fighting meane time footemen either side almost hungarian fought obstinacie hard iudge whether partie haue better barchit troupe vntill lay close ambuscado risen suddenly charged vnawares ferdinand report went worst bargaine barchit giuing fresh charge bodo notwithstanding day shewed himselfe lesse valiant souldier prudent captaine often attempting vaine haue rallied squadron ouerborne enemy taken prisoner together many excellent captaines campe assaulted ordinance colour likewise lost whole troupe much disordered running away left baggage austrian king iohn perceiued fast horse could beare fled holding himselfe safetie owne countrie fled poland ierom lasky nobleman countrey honorably king iohn flieth poland entertained ferdinand captaines entring transiluania countrie together hungary held without resistance yeelded deuotion forasmuch bodo vpon promise liberty would renounce oath made king iohn beare armes king ferdinand commandement cast dungeon griefe sorrow died miserably victory ferdinand made himselfe together wife alba regalis solemnly crowned king much victuall thought would satisfie hunger hauing yeelded found little corn wine would suffice army two day wherefore resolued passe riuer bodrogo go valpiano heard great store victual turk pursued restore whatsoeuer belonged power queene departed buda lippa son royall furniture accompanied baron except valentine cursing infidelity tirant queene driuen buda repenting hart accepted condition offered ferdinand giue prouince sepusia place taken might haue liued quiet minde haue son king whole realme subiect perfidious barbarian might doubt hourely would depriue said hapned sin haue rather trusted friendship cruel mahometan christian king milde iust faith durst discouer thought ferdinand hearing defeat army fear greater losse beeing also sorry losse buda place great importance defense christendome resolued condition propounded ferdinand soliman send ambassador presently conquering soliman condition peace dispatched vnto rich present falling riuer dannow came camplying buda honourably entertained rostan basha brought presence soliman deliuered ambassage requiring name ferdinand would grant realm hungary tribute king iohn paid promising satisfie queen behalf son shewing also said k iohn moued conscience told title kingdom hauing vniustly vsurpt promised death whereof produced contract reason whereof ferdinand made war two day pause soliman gaue answer ambassador rostan hee content giue peace ferdinand whensoeuer restore fort city solimans answer ambassador place hungary often prouoked war spent much yet would impose penalty paiment small tribute yeerly archduchy austria quit pretension hungary threatning ferdinand accept condition peace would fail take place arm vniustly vsurped ambassador said ferdinand could resolue accept condition without priuity emperor brother therfore craued time truce might write receiue answer soliman knew well designe onely win time end winter might approach war deferrd assuring ferdinand would neuer accept vnreasonable condition therefore hee would grant truce twentie day stay buda retired constantinople hauing giuen charge sangiac belgrado make incursion austria put fire sword hee commanded cacon constant wherewith much troubled repent time haue liued hauing imployed whole course life seruice god increase holy faith depart contented leaue thee son liuely image body soule trust although dead yet shall sort liue thou wilt imitate action according desire intreate thee doe thou louest thy selfe let thy chiefest study care end world may know thou art son strong pillar firme support house austria shall easie thy counsel action shall squared rule honesty honor next thou shalt set thine eye reputation glory rodvlphvs great prince honor house excellent emperor frederick thy great grandfather maximilian thy grandfather charles fift thine vncle inuincible emperours self thy father like good childe thou shalt imitate famous worthy deed make thee glorious future age thou shalt doe contrarie thou shalt reape nothing famy dishonor spring noble glorious prince held base vnworthy action doe concurre progenitor whose deedes without great iudgement recorded writing posterity shall needful tell thee helpes valiant worthy deedes progenitor haue giuen mee emperour brother laborious course liues action shew prince action imitate predecessor vertues know sonne leaue thee heauy burthen gouernment empire kingdomes thou prouest good vertuous prince seeme light vnto thee son one thy subiects may lament losse thy father saie striue exceede good vsage gouernment end empire state leaue thee thou maiest haue armes defend put thee minde like good father thou art doe happie valiant armes thing loued life thou wilt shew thy self son contemne death recommend strictly vnto thee worship religion reuerence sea rome honour god iustice thou wilt haue thy gouernment continue long consider wisemen direct action purchase fame world eternall glory come mean good name vain glory god may honored good example life work others shall succeede may take example thou must consider good prince may attaine seeke fame burnt diana temple alexander ivlivs cesar preiudiciall world good fame purchased good workes bad thou wouldest truly attaine others seeke striue rather called good prince great haue care rather better increase thine empire endeuoring imitate gouerne estate well got increased many seeking gaine another man lose owne prince subiects striue one thou wouldest haue thy people thou beest gamester play thou followest woman luxurious ambitious euery man seeke rise rate soeuer thou beest superstitious thou shalt see superstition raigne thou beest religious good prince profit bring thee thou wouldest free thy selfe heauie burthen importunity shew thy selfe much displeased ambition thou canst doe thou maiest call thy selfe happy thou shalt propound vertue reward thy labour thou shalt neuer liue discontented thy subiects wil like thou canst attaine thou maist sleepe securely finally put thee minde thou art thy subiects striue good thou wilt haue good greatest want prince haue men tell v truth wherefore giue liberty men may admonish reprooue thee doe freely hold prince chiefly want thy truest friend thou dost exceede men honor dignity must thou exceede vertue remember sonne commonweale instituted king king ordained commonweale many commonweales haue flourished without prince prince hath continued long without state striue rather beloued feared state long preserued feare whilest thou art feared thou shalt haue many enemy subiects thou art beloued thou shalt neede guarde euery vassaile halberdier thou wilt beloued loue loue purchased loue loue thy subiects sort thou maiest alwaies preferre generall good thine owne affection thy priuate intrest friend truth may credit giuen thy bare word another man oath haue care gouerne thy selfe bridling thine affection thy subiects thou wilt obey thy selfe shouldst thou obeyed others maintaine thy grauity sort becomes prince side pleasing courteous affable remember prince haue liued imitating good flying euill let nothing proceede thy mouth may iniurious dishonest punish man angry choler giues way reason thou maist afterwards repent carried away opinion vulgar alwaies embrace aduice wisemen commonweales may iustly called happy gouerned wise gouerne thy subiects sort thy care may man shall exceede thee good gouernement iustice whilest thou art yong set alwaies thine eye thou art prince pastor reuerence christian faith making account necessary prince follow striue seeme christian outward ceremony christian work offend god seeing thou hast sworne thy lord face darest thou punish one hath betrayed thee thou beest traytor thy lord powerfull prince staied circumspect respecting may doe ought doe imagining stand vpon high tower whereas world beholds vice concealed thou maiest defend thy state without preiudice thy subiects hold best course prince ordained commonwealth commonwealth prince remember codrvs otho although pagan desired rather die defend estate losse humane blood hold better iust man vniust prince good prince deserues great reward wicked merit grieuous punishment thou wilt held good prince striue like vnto god thing would doe three thing chiefly attributed vnto god power knowledge bounty hath first want rest king tyrant know difference betwixt king tyrant name action thou shalt doe workes tyrant may well whilest thou liuest tearme thee king thou art dead call thee tyrant wouldst thou know difference aristotle set betwixt king tyrant king affect good commonwealth tyrant seekes owne profit endeuour leaue thy kingdomes better leaue shall thy true glory consider contract condition betwixt prince people thou doest thou oughtst vnto thy subiects bound performe duty vnto thee face canst thou demand thy rent thou dost pay remember men beast thou art sheapheard men sheepe seeing men learne art whereby liue shouldst thou learn art become good prince excellent others contented name king prince striuing may call thee tyrant true prince kingdome commeth succession action striues free king gouernes command himselfe slaue cannot restraine bridle affection thou vauntst thy selfe free shouldst thou obey thy passion infamous brutish seruitude haue seene many freeman serue many slaues serued slaue seruant force cannot blamed seeing owne power avicious man voluntary slaue ought put number men wherefore loue liberty learne truely king carefull good gouernement thy subiects thou maist neuer sleepe one whole night without studie passe away thy time loose barbarous king especially persia maintained maiesty hiding themselues subiects thou side following example shalt keepe thy gate alwaies open poore rather rich haue neede thy fauor thy answeres follow aduice aristotle good milde giue thy selfe bitter sowre leaue vnto thy minister let man depart thee iustly discontented thou hast giue giue speedily cheerefully thine owne free giue cause thanke others fauors thou thy selfe doest banish thee seeke new meanes oppresse grieue thy subiects remember poore rich pay tribute exaction desirous doe good thou maist thinke haue lost day wherein thou hast assisted som one honor good vertuous rich powerfull thou shalt make men follow vertue admit idle men thy kingdomes breede world mischiefes tractable pardon thine owne iniuries equall thy selfe hath done thou canst take reuenge without preiudice thy subiects haue offended priuate man doth thee wrong greater thy power reuenge better thy clemency appeare let thy exercise honest holy good profitable commonwealth well becomes prince heare affliction grieuances subiects redresse imitate vnburthen themselues matter iustice thy chiefe office think alwaies meanes thou maist gouerne thy subiects endeuor alwaies know nature manner thine owne subiects also stranger alwaies peace friendshippe thy neighbor contend lest breede thee warre discord learne rather history experience dangerous pernicious warre let speciall remembrance vnto thee thou neuer vndertake warre hatred priuate interest thou shalt forced vnto let much thy selfe thy subiects consider first comodious whether vndertake leaue forced vnto let bee extreme necessity first endeuour make accord peace better iust warre thou must endeuor flie respect honor name christian much opposite vnto make war turk infidel otherwise make christian slaues force torment deny faith christ also ruine christendome prophane temple christ let neuer come thy minde make warre thine owne priuate interest ambition consider vnder colour making warre infidel lurkes much poyson thou hast conquered labor conuert faith christ principally good workes face canst thou aduise becom christian thou thine action worse infidel great matter conquer moore turkes shall see christian vertues shine thee thine wherefore labor conuert import much whether thy conuersation good bad thou dost conuerse therefore striue alwaies draw thy company good vertuous men chase away wicked vieious may corrupt thee hurtfull loue reprooue thee freely hate flatter thee doe obserue company pleasing vnto thee behoouefull thee beast venemous creature pernicious uhrtfull prince flatterer ambitious person vulgar sort know disposition prince doe alwaies thinke like vnto fauorites vertuous hold vertuous wicked vicious esteeme like consider carefull thou oughtest making choice shall conuerse thee chiefly make choice confessor sincere pure incorrupt good life fame ambitious principall part good gouernement thy kingdome consists thou beest good second thou prouide good minister wherefore consider well thou giuest thy office thy benefice thy bishoppericks none worthy administration commonweale take constraint wherefore would profitable vnto thee neuer giue office benefice bishopperick seekes vertuous full bashfulnesse sue thing know certaine seek insufficient gouerne either know demand know deserue know demand discouer themselues proud ambitious wicked neuer commit matter iustice men vncorrupt good accept intreated committing others thy subiects shall suffer oppression nothing pernicious haue couetous iudges affect gouernement oppresse people let iudges keepe residence forget sometimes ouersee rewarding good punishing badde would haue thee vse clemency thy seruants shall forget duty punish rigour men bound good neere vnto thee also part infamy redounds vpon thee punish falsewitnesses scandalous accuser talions law making lawes haue respect vnto publike good thine owne particular thou shalt see profitable thy subiects intreate thee diligent resolute thou hast doe lest action thou losest occasion benefit thankes striue euer purchase good name rather rich great estate one wicked men attaine vnto money good men purchase vertue loue feare god teach thee rest guide thee thy action haue long desired speake vnto thee neuer oportunity wherefore intreate thee deere sonne imprint thine heart thou maist neuer forget lastly commend vnto thee thy brother sister kinsfolkes intreate sort may disgraced old father dead growe proude seeing brother emperor moreouer recommend vnto thee old seruants long care trouble warres affaire long infirmitie haue cause much toyle serued faithfully vnto death reason rewarded although bodie remaines graue wormes yet alwaies mindefull god herein thou shalt shew thy selfe good sonne rewarding serued thy father aboue thing put thee mind hold good aduice euer peace league philip king spaine nephew thy cozen sonne father loued much thou maist alwaies receiue good assistance shall fit thee make league infidel exhort doe two force may facility ruine common enemy commend vnto brother haue enioyned obedient vnto loue liue peace charitie like good brother shall bee great ioy vnto mee blessing shall bee thee together grace lord god giue infinite thankes hee hath done mee fauour might speake vnto thee blesse thee hand doe life maximilian second name hvndreth seventeenth telling master fraudulent proposition turk liued would haue set liberty hauing brought thither treat peace betwixt sultan emperor dead hee would send seruants caesar let vnderstand mahomet giuen charge besiege vienna knew farre easie iauerine extolled emperours power disgraced german wishing emperor would time aduise army march peace might made sent buda son gouerner greece calling secretary hee made many complaint wrong done turk put hope liberty sending mean time one emperor condition said peace might concluded say emperor would restore castle fort taken territory christian would leaue sisseck caesar would take protection transiluanians valachians moldauians lastly would duely pay annuall tribute many yeers omitted condition giuen one writing condition returned emperor answer turk proposition answer day rest dy barling returned emperor answer neuer intent maintain firm peace sultan hauing alway sought condition subiects might freed fatall war making repetition iniuries successe said beglerbey much deceiued thought roman emperor reduced streights would accept condition peace vniust soeuer turk soon knowe neither wanted force courage defend recouer bin lost treachery alwaies might besome meanes peace otherwise way reconcilement charles earle mandsfeld sonne peter ernest hauing spent many yeeres count mandsfeld go hungary command christian army warres flanders france emperour king spain good liking called hungary gouerne warres vnder archduke matthias carried two thousand horse six thousand foote wallons force came prague emperour much honour began reform martiall discipline leade army circumspection formerly marched accompanied duke ferrara mantoa others great note vienna altenbourg fifty thousand foote fifteene thousand horse laid siege strigonium besieged christiant strigonium first assault took old town turk flying new planted ordinance battered new towne saint thomas fort small breach made entred put sword planting three battery making large breach commanded assault giuen castle repulst great losse beglarbie gouernour greece drew together great army relieue besieged approaching neere vnto christian mandsfeld went forth meete hauing put army battaile basha buda seeing himselfe inferior valor multitude retired confusedly christian pursuing put whole army flight comming againe renew battaile christian disordered fled count mandsfeld knowing must either vanquish raise siege resolued giue battaile whole army hauing made great slaughter turkes ordinance army comming ioyne defeated quite slew six thousand among died basha iauerin son beglarby greece sore wounded fled buda next day count mandsfeld summoned towne yeeld whereunto answered although despaired help yet resolued preferre glorious death ignominious life whereupon christian incensed answer returned againe fresh charge count mandsfeld liue enioy fruit victory hauing spent force spirit battaile playing part commander count mand feld dy tongue souldier hand thousand chased mountaines reduced extremity forced go humble suppliant emperor offer wife child hostage garrison pappa consisting part walloon french fell mutinie pay hauing also scarcity victual made one called la mott puppa betray garrison captaine forcing companion signe reuolt seized vpon marot gouernor captaines set turkes liberty counsell traitor carried euery man hoste prisoner alba regalis vesperine withall promised deliuer svvartzenbovrg lieutenant generall imperiall army giue meanes take zolnock come pay marot gouernor found meanes aduertise hereof went thither presently nine thousand men first comming tooke one captaines caused fleyed aliue head set vpon pike terrifie rest hee took basha whereby hope relieued turke could assist either men prouision hunger prest grew desperate hauing hope humane aide whereupon salied night made great slaughter one quarter svvartzenbovrg runnes thither repaire disorder ouerthrowne shot slaine death caused great heauinesse imperiall army christendome cause lament losse wretch made second salie saying would yeeld would feede vpon gouernour marot prisoner melchior reder wonne much honor defence varradine charge army pressed siege traitor indured last extremity posterne gate behinde put hope safety seeking make dry poole inuiron towne one side mudde would easily carry could couer secretly hardles strawe reede material reder aduertised hereupon sent nadasti earle thurne colonits ouertaking neere vnto wood brought back prisoner slew la mott captaine hundred others would yield forcing rest keepe themselues within fort gouernour marott certaine others freed themselues bondes came speedily vnto campe reder enters town kils remainder reserues rest deserued punishment sent diuers garisons horror example cruel intreated maiesty vmpire betwixt king poland would procure peace country prouide good worthy prince formerly required king p ands sonne great duke end purpose diuers sundry time sent vnto king found intent vnder pretext thereof might easily subdue fell againe ioyning battaile farre city musco slew many polonians intent callin charls son king swethen emperour could meanes prouide would willingly obey newes came court controuersie growne betwixt n gronivs emperours ambassador const inople nassvs basha confirmation peace made yeeres ambassadour perswading turkes entertain peace made nassvs basha required shew wherin emperor satisfied answered sixt article transaction violated caesar king hungary hauing lawfull title vnto transiluania required haue article ratified nassvs denied affirming transiluania properly belong vnto sultan vpon point grew great contention betwixt whereby appeared turkes sought nothing colour infringe peace emperour aduertized hereof gaue answere vnto persian ambassador would al mean imbrace entertain friendship king master desired deceased emperour brother although resolued continue warre turkes yet hindred sedition hungary forced make peace seeing turkes hauing seized vpon moldauia valachia practise inuade transiluania would conferre prince state empire aduertise king done perswading meane time continue warres answered muscouites would interpose authority making peace betwixt king poland prouide great duke country soone emperour appoints dut ratisbon emperour sent letter elector prince empire complaining turkes iniustice shewing dishonorable thing would christian commonwealth suffer goodly prouince inuaded spoiled without opposition writing also letter state imperiall city aduanced empire first chiefest care settle peace tranquillity iustice might duly administred iealousies distrust taken away firme de ired concord state empire might ready vpon occasion ioynt force resist enemy christian name specially peace made
