could arm beginning october collonell called goltsteine entred bohemia shotte committing infinite insolencies spoiles territory satser countreymen fell vpon slew part count bvcqvoy called bohemia archduke leopold presently took horne towne lower austria transiluanans ioyne bohemian left againe marcht suam towne morauia nine thousand horse foote hee presently summoned garrison prepared defence hearing twelue thousand hungarian transiluanians drew neere marched away night went ioyne earle tampierre meane time transiluanians ioyned bohemian morauians certaine company hungarian left earle tampierre goe vnto transiluanians earle thurn seeing himselfe thus fortified hauing six twenty thousand men great fight betwixt imperial protestant army resolued rhed generall transiluanians goe fight count bvcqvoy finding force weak left first lodging went encamped outward bridge riuer danuow whither archduke leopold came vienna view army enemy came great fury vpon rereward slue fiue hundred earle tampierres men leopold prest count bvcqvoy fight finding counsell dangerous contained himselfe within camp euening began skirmish continued almost till midnight ordinance playing continually small losse either side morning fight beganne againe furiously many slaine murdered ordinance earle bucquoy great losse camp beeing three barrells powder set fire negligence carelesnesse many slaine drowned riuer fight continued vntill night ouerpressed bohemian abandoned fort end bridge retired vnto side breaking bridge number dead body vncertaine many carried next day vnto vienna waggon whereof died soon count bvcqvoy shotte arme lieutenant generall three seuerall wound mortall bethlin gabor mean time marcht great army presburg taking bethlin take presbourg way castle petronel burnt newes heerof brought vnto vienna sent three company foot three piece ordinance boat entred suburb presbourg october night tempestuous rainy windy transiluanians imbraced occasion surprised souldiers slept without fear whereof slain commander others fled away suburb surprised bethlin summoned palatine answer whether would defend town castle yeeld without force hauing day granted consult palfi nobleman able defend resolued yeeld mean time new elect king bohemia wife child whole train came walsacken whither ambassador bohemia incorporated prouinces came vnto whereas one name rest deliuered reason rejected emperor gouernment bohemia made choice king giuing many thanks acceptance praying happy long continuance ended deliuered vnto reuersall letter promised coronation take oath example predecessor king bohemia confirme priuiledges immunity liberty right statute antient laudable customes bohemia especially charter granted emperor rodvlph second king bohemia state inhabitant said realm free exercise religion whatsoeuer else might concern good realm incorporated prouinces letter reuersall confirmed vnder hand seal beeing receiued deputy returned egra king queen whole court past arriued prague last october may omit elector palatine course going bohemia hauing met palatine archbishop mentz answer diuerse confederate prince rottenbourg departure hee sent archbishop elector mentz propounded whereas pleased god lately chosen king bohemia resolued accept thereof desired know grace tearms estate stood electorall house mentz whether correspondency long time maintained betwixt house continue still firm inuiolable whereas prince palatine vnderstood good force neer hand hee demanded whither went whether grace would vouchsafe passage elector mentz answered would obserue antient correspondency elector mentz haue elector palatine inuiolaby lawfull thing touching concerned tumult bohemia hee appointed iudge neither concern army knew nothing certain hitherto denied man passage continued still minde gaue good security according constitution roman empire repair damage yet would conferre touching article elector soon vicar generall gouerner heidelberg staid reuenues clergy mentz spire wormes teuton knight hold palatinate elector mentz moued many complaint clergie sent vnto vicar generall councell palatinate expostulate seizure clergy rent adding withall hitherto onely good concord maintained betwixt electorall house mentz palatinate departure prince elector palatine prague sent ambassadour confirmation future maintenance said correspondency betwixt house neuer expected complaint prohibition would haue made good neighbour whereunto made answere ignorant promise made either side aduertised clergy promised great summe money crowne spaine oppression bohemian elector palatine especially bound answere counsellor elector palatine elector mentz consideration granted inhibition ecclesiasticall rent neither blamed man iudgement would thinke fit aide go vnto forrain prince territory owne prince subdue bohemian lo palatine therefore elector mentz others concerned would take course aide sent preiudice bohemian lord palatine resolution might expected soon elector mentz hauing written letter elector palatine freed clergy inhibition elect king bohemia haue said comn prague last october met director nobility certain troups horse foot conducted citty arm receiued great ioy acclamation king bohemia enters prague decreed generall state bohemia king receiue moity tribute rent contribution queen fourth part euery man pay due yeerly feast george director freed oath giue account vnto assembly money disbursed commonweale director gouernors kingdom yield gouernment arm vnto king imploy defence himselfe kingdom incorporated prouinces vsing yet aduice governor decree made realm prouinces commissioner sent examine harm bin done country consideration might therof next stateassembly c mandsfeldt meaning recouer certain place bvcqvoy taken marcht wintenbourg gouernor refusing yield vpon summons earle forced port diuers townes recouered protestant bohemia petard entring put garrison sword except fewe taken prisoner diuers town castle yeelded willingly garrison departing buduitz earl marcht praguditz garrison put themselues defence took town force october army marcht wodean knowing weakely mand two nobleman bohemia serued emperor retired town hauing stopt passage sought force garrison made great resistance yet next day gouernor compounded depart willingly granted two nobleman might deliuered vnto sent prague committed prison thing meane time made ready presbourg put shore nine clock landed troop first approach seised vpon suburb forced fort built vpon riuer dannow brake bridge boat succeeding well resolued attempt castle petard conceiuing might body earle tampierre presbourg caused bee honourably interred baron de prener taking charge assembled foot routed army horse hee staid course hungarian transiluanians made incursion euen gate vienna afflicted especially great misery befallen turke preparing enter germany hoped god would direct heart emperour elector prince assist assembly counsells consultation would tend onely restoring peace alter thing point religion policie mandsfeld knowing resolution state vper palatinate taken seeing passage would cut bauarians finde little meanes releeue army auoide danger pressed potent aduersary want money pay souldiers meanes releeue hee made offer submit himselfe emperours obedience promising serue army might receiue certaine summe money giue content whereupon hauing receiued mansfeld offe eth submit self emperor part deliuered vp fortification verdhause hee could longer keepe bauarians treaty mandsfeld hath beene diuersly censured haue thought policie onely entertaine time finde meanes pythanivs gouernour answered seruant could yeeld without resolution vnited state consenting would vse delay answere fell cannon side againe pressed yeeld said expect easter yet began treate spaniard wiues child good ordinance munition remaine city gunner armorer smith carpenter others might depart souldiers gouernour captaine haue horse waggon carry good nemigen sicke wounded might stay towne vntill recouered haue waggon carry nymegen captaines souldiers haue whole yeares liberty sell land souldiers townes castle haue leaue come thither bring wiues child armes commodity belonging towne castle bee left behinde recordes antient writing towne castle remaine still souldiers arrested debt bedds souldiers brought towne shold restored owner bound receiue elector brandenburghs officer ministerrs execute office space one whole yea e citizen might depart city dispose good within one yeare thar two hostage giuen either side vntill article performed signed sealed gouernour send one friendship pleased maiesty giue assurance sincere loue affection many stately embassy endeauoring still settle peace christendome whereas ill affected sought trouble quiet state europe combustion none maiesty endeauord reconcile like rising sun dispel cloudy vapour dissension great honor royal name worthy work intreating maiesty emperours name continue still course prince europe might onely enioy peace meanes might haue fruition desire immortall fame let vnderstand highly imperiall maiesty esteeme loue affection endeuour gratifie farre honourable correspondence might extend sent ambassadour acquaint maiesty gracious intent assure affect common good christendom especially welfare maiesties house although cause discontent ye part care decayed peace beene interrupted turbulent spirit might restored acknowledging violent course beene distastfull vnto maiesty regall piety alwaies endeauored preuent mischiefes aswell generall good christendome settling peace germany beene dismembred dissension whereas imperiall maiesty taken armes owne defence maintaining honor dignity said would easily entreated lay againe desist hostility others without iust cause shew themselues refractarie tractable maiesty could nobly act part defending dignity king prerogatiue monarch conclusion imperiall maiesty worthy intent treate sincerely really without fraude affaire might bee firmly ratified performed whereunto king spaine also willing ready harken imperial maiesties proposition maiesty think fit treate neither doubt work generally good charitable perfitable prouinces europe would haue happie successe nothing intended truth sincerity hope indissoluble friendship maiesty well pleased proposition willingly embraced offer sir richard weston sent bruss l treaty appointed brussels whereupon honourable dismission said ambassadour maiesty made choice sir richard weston chancellor exchequer counsellor state employed action whome sent presently treate peace elector restitution hereditarie land dignity treaty procure cessation armes end obstacle might taken away maiesty soone sent lord chichester baron belface palatinate acquainte sonne law elector treaty might conforme accordingly whereby exception might taken followed fruite treaty good men wish neither suspension armes peace concluded six moneths treaty maiesties ambassadour returned home without satisfaction world coniecture moneth duke bauaria sent ambassador duke virtemberg requiring duke virtemberg refuse send souliers bauarian send souldiers leuied hauing neede emploied count mansfeld duke answered quarrell palatinate defence whereof mandsfield employed besides contrary treaty vlme decreed nothing attempted palatinate moreouer souldiers leuied state defence countrey could drawne away place falling vpon troupe count mandsfelds horse three thousand foote wingart ouerthrew took hundred fiftie waggon fiue hundred horse great prey rest sauing selues flight prepare way saie heidelberg fourth defended valiantly hauing endured foure fierce assault forced retire great losse leauing great store armes ladder behinde truce made burying dead retyring wounded tilly sending messenger heidelberg promise intent annoy towne force castle whereupon returned armes tenth aprill continuing battery ten clock morning till six night made breach walles garrison resolutely defend enemy ceasing giue assault summoned againe yeeld garrison refused requiring three day respite consult granted sent messenger manheim heidelberg ayde returned aprill comfortable newes onely haue ayde electour palatine himselfe comming part againe pressed generall tilly yeelde gouernor answered yet ready defend dayes longer would come treaty meane time aduertised camp succor comming elector palatine arriued country vp palatinat goe enemy countrey hee tooke generous resolution rather hazard life abandon afflicted subject wherefore march hee departed hague imbarked himselfe arrived callis small company hee disguised attendant one passed part france went sedan lorrane bitssi comming inne fell amongst archduke leopolds souldiers table heard raile freely palatine hee swallowed quietly past thence night aboue hundred men sent presently duke brunswick force townesmen seeing approach grew amazed fled presently watergate wiues child best substance past maine going mentz franckfort whereupon entred towne castle next day army came thither meane time tilly cordova lying ashaffenbourg army thirty thousand men least sent two hundred foote two troups horse night relieue hoest met withall defeated brvnsvvicks troups seuenth iune passed maine towards franckfort duke brunswick hearing enemy march sent count mandsfeld let vnderstand posture stood resoluing would continue still vntill might march vnto whose passage owne retreate forced prepared bridge ouer maine count mandsfeld receiued newes marching designe breake bridge oppenheim failing make diuersion thereby draw gonzales homewards commaunding threescore cornet horse march presently towards duke meaning himselfe follow rest army stayed contrary news ouerthrow shall heare whitsonday souldiers hauing burned many village thereabouts bauarians marched regiment foote cornet horse peeces ordinance brunswick defeated bauarians hoest meane time duke brunswick encamped himselfe sent carriage ouer bridge enemy approaching camp fight beganne presently continued six houres bauarians peeces ordinance fitly placed much annoy horse brvnsvvick three whereof one broken beginning another made vnseruiceable enemy cannon could make fight good notwithstanding footemen fought valiantly duke aduice commander retired himselfe whereupon whole army fell confusion fled presently towards bridge reason narrownesse thereof many turned riuer drowned bauarians durst pursue fled fearing stratagem duke brunswick waded riuer fiue troupe horse lost baggage many souldiers flight threw away armes great losse number dead vncertaine many horse foote drowned passage riuer losse beene farre greater bauarians horse pursue side riuer great cause brag victory three strong army ioyned one hauing six time much ordinance duke came mainheme gathering together scattered troupe losse mustered horse foot tilly retiring defeate towards frankfart caused bridge built steinheym passhis army ouer riuer maine finished diuided army tilly went schrise fort taken vpon riuer neccar cordova encamped ladenbuurg making bridge heidelberg manner blockt vp without hostile attempt whilst emperour continued edenbourg assembly state hungary bassadour king denmark emperor arriued ambassadour king denmark intercede againe restitution elector palatine hereditarie country dignity intreating maiesty fatherly affection commonwealth innocent subiects hee would change minde preferring clemencie rigour suffer elector palatine reconciled vnto often shewed himselfe ready state empire renounce crowne bohemia himselfe heires yeeld due obedience vnto imperiall maiesty might enioy hereditarie possession electorall dignity recouer beene taken maiesty thought offence could easily pardoned cause sufficient prosecute execution proscription yet could let vnderstand extremity whereas publike safety da ger needfull proceede according rigour law remember worthy saying antient necessarie doe thing according mine owne wherefore could intreate maiesty againe seeing elector palatine ready vpon former condition make renunciation submission satisfaction would end vanquish himselfe forget conceiued displeasure good commonwealth whereby free many thousand death despaire hee make end warre deuastation country settle peace publike quiet restore commonweale life agonie death breathing hir soule conclude bind nobleman subiects yea enemy vnto would ready employ liues fortune cause necessity would also poure forth vowes prayer health safety emperour answere danish ambassador made ample relation emperor answere vnto danish ambassadour proceeding bohemian combustion hapned since yeere formerly donne others notwithstanding great victory hee got prague changed minde alwaies enclyned peace appointed diuers assembly elector prince meaning assist person settling general peace disappointed count mandsfeld leauying new force vpper palatinate entred confines bohemia meaning infest againe opposed duke bauaria hee christian duke brunswick committed many outrage alsatia westphalia elector palatine could excuse himselfe proceeding signes repentance obstinate malice yet sent earle swartsenberg king great brittaine acquaint condition whereby suspension armes might bee obtained referred infanta spaine remaining brnssels yea beene content elector prince meete touching business yet meane time could receiue conclusion frederick elector palatine neglecting treaty father law often desired came againe empire ioyned mandsfeld others end might inuade territory elector prince beene faithfull vnto whereby king denmark might well perceiue patience endured affront finally receiue aduice ambassador brussels fit done touching desired treaty would resolue king finde interposition vain ambassador seeming well satisfied emperor answer vpon second audience ambassador reply emperor gaue vnderstand master would make question trouble bohemia punishing motiues seeing imperiall maiesty recouered kingdome incorporated prouinces part force part treaty king aim nothing see end warre misery peace tranquillity might restored due obedience maiesty offense forgotten perfect loue trust confirmed among state nothing wanting elector palatine ready make renunciation honest satisfaction desiring nothing owne hereditary country electorall dignity enioyned trouble apparant world duke bauaria alone laboured expel force must necessity passe hauing good army souldiers infinite number boores write mansfeld comming neere vnto cordovaes campe sent trumpet vnto know whether would giue passage fight answering charge stop passage fight earle presently prepared charge knowing daunger delay men performed resolutely put cordovaes men route surprised ordinance boores kept space two houres afterwards recouered againe whereupon fight grew cruell duke brunswick behauing himselfe valiantly shot left arme neere vnto wrist yet notwithstanding would leaue field continued still fighting losse blood heate wound enflamed afterwards hee enforced haue arme cut aboue elbow conclude long fight count mandsfeld hauing slaine many especially boores cordova forced sound retreit whereupon count mansfeld duke brunswick master field marched directly towards breda hauing taken much enemy baggage ordinance men lost battaile certaine comming breda mustered written men besides many sick weary came daily vnto cannot relate particular circumstance battaile diuersly reported haue written thereof particular loss neither doth concerne history limit empire thus much dare boldly affirme one resolute desperate exploit hath great penalty duke saxony hauing notice giuen alteration bohemia touching shutting vp protestant church much discontented regard owne particular religion might time subiect like calamity rest protestant prince germany also houlding honour blemished reduction country emperor obedience hee promised warrant emperor church molested depriued free exercise religion hauing also taken protection therefore duke obiected proceeding emperor ambassador wrong done beeing still importuned petition preacher driuen country wrote prince lichtenstein effect forasmuch hee could take notice sundry aduertisements bohemia incorporated prouinces also complaint diuerse preacher lately banished country restraint duke saxony writes prince lichtenstein publike profession reformed religion shutting vp church putting school yet men miserie commonly seek moue pity report estate alwaies better conceited maiesties word promised country could bee reduced obedience force maiesties direction passe word subiects prouinces reformed religion still enioy freedome conscience wherefore relying vpon emperor word would rashly giue credit information till might hear certainty authority commission manner executed wherefore could lesse fauour cause honour owne word whereon inhabitant prouinces much relied entreat earnestly aduertise truth businesse found conformable petitioner complaint could hold honor ingaged take care timely remedy withall imploy credit power imperiall maiesty staying future proceeding think alteration bohemia staied duke saxony iourney diet regensbourg continuing discontent gaue emperor vnderstand letter much grieued shutting vp protestant church prague belong bohemian elector prince germany professing gospell built maintained owne charge procured great priuiledges immunity wherefore maiesty protestant bohemia elector prince empire suffer owne religion contrary imperiall promise priuiledges empire persecuted oppressed may breed new combustion trouble vnlesse shall please emperour restore church former estate condition siege glatz continued still resolutely attempted imperialist obstinately defended besieged young earle thurne making many salies vpon enemie cloyed cannon returned good spoiles much honour continuance siege glats september accident much impaire state town setting fire suburb end imperialist lodge spark fell chance powder whereby part town much prouision burnt like wise part wall two peeces ordinance falling downe violence fire imperialist aduanced scallado valiantly repulsed garrison middest october imperialist assaulted towne great fury within suffering approach walles hauing discharged ordinance presently set open port salied forth one thousand horse foot slue six hundred enemy retired great losse faction warre glatz parley young earle thurne gouernour towne earle torquato generall emperours army prince lichtenstein gouernour bohemia many proposition made vnto young earle promise pardon great reward himselfe souldiers emperor name would yeeld vp towne young earle thurn made answere could procure king bohemia free double oath one subject soldier would yeeld vp towne castle would also forsake quarrell lay armes seeing could dispense oath companie resolued make good imperialist although might haply great losse charge take towne yet castle retreat would defend last man treaty brake euery man returning quarter presently made great salie bloody many slaine either side among thirteen captain imperialist annoyed campe ordinance emperour commanded force bohemia march towards glatz reenforce siege sent
